tags: act, action, answer, answered-prayer, belief, cosmology, creation, creativity, creator, deity, divinity, doing, faith, god, goddess, godhood, gods, inspirational, monotheism, movement, mystery, myth, pantheon, polytheism, prayer, prayers, prayers-answered, religion, religions, response, the-word, theology, truth, wisdom, word

quote: So the key is doing something that sets you apart forever in the minds of regular people.Something that matters.
author: Matthew Quick, Forgive Me, Leonard Peacock
tags: creativity, expressing-yourself, shocking

quote: Don't be afraid of silly ideas.
author: Paul Arden, It's Not How Good You Are, It's How Good You Want To Be
tags: courage, creativity, empowerment, experiments, fear, ideas, silliness

quote: Up on the Brooklyn Bridge a man is standing in agony, waiting to jump, or waiting to write a poem, or waiting for the blood to leave his vessels because if he advances another foot the pain of his love will kill him.
author: Henry Miller, Black Spring
tags: artist, artists-life, blocks, bridge, brooklyn, creativity, love, poem, poetry, suffering, suicide, writing

quote: The job of taste was to thin the insane torrent of human creativity down to manageable levels. But the job of appetite was never to be happy with taste.
author: Richard Powers, Orfeo
tags: appetite, creativity, taste

quote: As every so-called creative spirit soon learns, the rest of the world doesn't particularly give a damn.
author: Gary Shteyngart, Little Failure
tags: creativity, life, world

quote: YOU DON’T KNOW IF YOUR IDEA IS ANY GOOD the moment it’s created. Neither does anyone else. The most you can hope for is a strong gut feeling that it is. And trusting your feelings isnot as easy as the optimists say it is. There’s a reason why feelings scare us—because what they tell us and what the rest of the world tells us are often two different things.
author: Hugh MacLeod, Ignore Everybody: and 39 Other Keys to Creativity
tags: creativity, feeling, gut, idea, people

quote: Creativity is in the heart of the dreamer.
author: Tammy L. Kubasko, My Gift to You: The Comfort Zone
tags: creativity, dreamer, heart, inspirational, moon, stars

quote: The spirit of an artist's gifts can wake our own.
author: Lewis Hyde "The Gift"
tags: artist, awakening, creativity, gift, imagination, inspiration, spirit, talent, writer

quote: Don't Stop Searching Until You Find Creative & Gainful Unemployment
author: Dean Cavanagh
tags: creativity, unemployment

quote: Hobbies are like flowers on plant. They make the plant look beautiful and feel Proud.
author: Sukant Ratnakar, Open The Windows: To the World around You
tags: creativity, flowers, hobbies

quote: Creatives fail and the really good ones fail often.
author: Steven Kotler
tags: creativity, failing, failure, success, trying

quote: Writing creatively is a process of self-consumption that requires one to dive deeply inside of oneself with no guarantee of reemergence.
author: Ashim Shanker, Sinew of the Social Species
tags: creativity, dedication-and-attitude, detachment, dive-into-oneself, meditation, self-consumption, self-denial, writing-process-creative-process

quote: And observe, you are put to stern choice in this matter. You must either make a tool of the creature, or a man of him. You cannot make both. Men were not intended to work with the accuracy of tools, to be precise and perfect in all their actions. If you will have that precision out of them, and make their fingers measure degrees like cogwheels, and their arms strike curves like compasses, you must unhumanize them. All the energy of their spirits must be given to make cogs and compasses of themselves....On the other hand, if you will make a man of the working creature, you cannot make a tool. Let him but begin to imagine, to think, to try to do anything worth doing; and the engine-turned precision is lost at once. Out come all his roughness; all his dullness, all his incapability; shame upon shame, failure upon failure, pause after pause: but out comes the whole majesty of him also, and we know the height of it only, when we see the clouds settling upon him.
author: John Ruskin, The Stones of Venice
tags: creativity, excellence, imperfection, inspirational, perfection, wisdom

quote: For certain you can be helped, should you accept it. But as far as being made...no one can do that. This occurred on the day you were born. An earth day is not a birth day. Own what you create as well as what you break.
author: T.F. Hodge, From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph Over Death and Conscious Encounters with "The Divine Presence"
tags: birth, birthday, born, create, creativity, earth-day, responsibility

quote: It is the power of questions that embolden us and keep us as expectant children, all the while developing the power of human consciousness.
author: Dan Sanders, The Circle of Six: Emily's Quest
tags: creativity, curiosity, questions

quote: Every creative force has an equal power to destroy.
author: Curtis Bill Pepper, Leonardo: A Biographical Novel
tags: balance, creativity, destructive

quote: Our actions are highly magnetic to our thoughts.
author: Sukant Ratnakar, Open The Windows: To the World around You
tags: actions, anger, attitude, creativity, happiness, smile, thoughts

quote: Not everybody has a talent for painting, or for the piano, or for dance. But we can write our way into the artist's head and into his problems and solutions. Or we can go there with another writer.
author: William Zinsser
tags: art, creativity, insight

quote: Sometimes I think that creativity is a matter of seeing, or stumbling over, unobvious similarities between things—like composing a fresh metaphor, but on a more complex scale. One night in Hiroshima it occurred to me that the moon behind a certain cloud formation looked very like a painkiller dissolving in a glass of water. I didn’t work toward that simile, it was simply there: I was mugged, as it were, by the similarity between these two very different things. Literary composition can be a similar process. The writer’s real world and the writer’s fictional world are compared, and these comparisons turned into text. But other times literary composition can be a plain old slog, and nothing to do with zones or inspiration. It’s world making and the peopling of those worlds, complete with time lines and heartache.
author: David Mitchell
tags: creativity, metaphor, writing, writing-process

quote: To be creative is to look Madness in the eye and challenge it to a spitting contest.
author: River Fairchild
tags: creativity, humor, life-lessons

quote: Daemons had minds of their own, which could never be harnessed, even by those who sheltered them.
author: Curtis Bill Pepper, Leonardo: A Biographical Novel
tags: creativity, daemons, independence

quote: My advice would be to write-never to stop writing, to keep it up all the time, to be painstaking about it, to write until you begin to write.
author: Gabriel Fielding
tags: advice-for-writers, creativity, writing

quote: When students cheat on exams it's because our school system values grades more than students value learning.
author: Neil deGrasse Tyson
tags: authority, conformity, creativity, education, fear, learning, school, school-reform, science

quote: Play is just another version of work
author: Ray Kurzweil, The Singularity is Near: When Humans Transcend Biology
tags: creativity, play, work

quote: Self-conciousness is the enemy of all creativity.
author: Ray Bradbury, Fahrenheit 451
tags: creativity, self-consciousness

quote: What a face this girl possessed!—Could I neither die then nor gaze at her face every day, I would need to recreate it through painting or sculpture, or through fatherhood, until a second such face could be born.
author: Roman Payne, The Wanderess
tags: art, artist, artistic-desire, artistic-passion, artistic-urge, artists-life, beauty, creation, creationism, creativity, desire, face, faces, fatherhood, girls, painters, payne, psyche, rebirth, roman, roman-payne, sculpture, the-wanderess, urges, wanderess, women

quote: The dancing vortex of a sacred metaphor clashes horns and halos to make wounded music set to the tempo of a new era in brilliant labor.
author: Aberjhani, The River of Winged Dreams
tags: angels, celebrating-poetry, classic-books, classic-quotes, creative-work, creativity, healing, metaphors, moving-on, music, nanowrimo, national-poetry-month, poem-in-your-pocket-day, poems-by-aberjhani, poetry-celebrations, recovery, spirituality, symbolism, vortex, world-poetry-day

quote: You'll become that devil overnight, if you want to become that celebrity overnight.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
tags: aspiration, aspirations, celebrity, club, craving, creative-mind, creativity, darkness, desire, devil, magnet, magnetism, michael-bassey-johnson, movement, night, overnight, progress, secret-society, success, yearn, yearning

quote: Any man who bears the ability of a polymath shall not be interfered by specialty, he needs discipline to manage his behaviors and nurture his creativity.
author: Shawn Lukas
tags: art, creativity, manifestation, polymath, talent

quote: I watched him carefully. He was making art because he has to, and because he's brave enough to try and make contact, right there on the edge of madness, where he dreams.
author: Anne Lamott, Traveling Mercies: Some Thoughts on Faith
tags: art, creativity

quote: Rest nurtures creativity, which nurtures activity. Activity nurtures rest, which sustains creativity. Each draws from and contributes to the other.
author: Kim John Payne, Simplicity Parenting: Using the Extraordinary Power of Less to Raise Calmer, Happier, and More Secure Kids
tags: creativity, parenting, rest

quote: A man never knows exactly how the child of his brain will strike other people.
author: William Howard Taft
tags: creativity, doris-kearns-goodwin, taft

quote: Art is a kind of magic. Creativity is mysterious, even to artists, who might be able to name their inspiration but can't always explain how their influences and experiences came together to create this new thing- this painting, this story, this song. If you break art down to its base elements, there's nothing miraculous about the letters of the alphabet or a drop of paint. But an artist can put those elements together to create something powerful, something that moves us and withstands the test of time. A work that no one but that artist could have imagined, let alone created.
author: Sarah Cross, Shadowhunters and Downworlders: A Mortal Instruments Reader
tags: art, creativity, inspiration, music, writing

quote: No one can take credit for inspiration or creativity.
author: Ron Brackin
tags: boasting, creativity, credit, inspiration

quote: Very few of us understand Honorable Bird, except to acknowledge that without his power and grace nothing would be written, painted, or composed at all. To say anything beyond this about the creative process is like pulling all the petals off a flower in order to analyze it, and ending up having destroyed the flower.
author: Madeleine L'Engle, A Circle of Quiet
tags: art, creativity, holy-spirit

quote: The vitality of art is its capacity for infinite expansion. One form doesn't preclude another any more than the existence of Mozart makes the existence of Bach superfluous.
author: Lloyd Alexander
tags: art, creativity

quote: The life of a writer is directed by a mad impulsive muse, that can tell them to cancel all their storyline: a creative divergent devil.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
tags: creation, creativity, devil, divergence, every-writer, impulse, impulsion, innovation, madness, mental-discoveries, michael-bassey-johnson, muse, plot, storyline, talent, talents, the-life-of-the-writer, writer, writers

quote: Collaboration is key, it takes innovation and creativity to the next room.
author: Shawn Lukas
tags: art, collaboration, creativity, innovation, key

quote: Some writers aren't writers, they are mere escapees' and refugees' on an exile from the jungle of thoughts.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
tags: alibi, creativity, escapade, escape, escapee, freelance, freelancer, great-mind, intellect, michael-bassey-johnson, pen, publishing, random-thought, refuge, scribble, writer, writers, writing

quote: His art springs out of bubbling underground necessity, as if he's somehow dipping himself into the river that gave him life; he's making dream material visible.
author: Anne Lamott, Traveling Mercies: Some Thoughts on Faith
tags: art, creativity

quote: Giving these students, teenagers, any form of power over the use of their own words, allowing them to turn everyday raw material into some form of beauty, is a gift beyond measure.
author: Gloria Ng
tags: creative-writing, creativity, on-poetry, writing

quote: It's not a sign of creativity to have sixty-five ideas for one problem. It's just a waste of energy.
author: Jan Kaplicky
tags: creativity, energy, ideas, overkill, problems

quote: Ideas doesn't make anyone rich, it is what you use it to do that makes you rich.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
tags: creative-thoughts, creativity, fortune, hardwork, ideas, implementation, inspiration, luck, michael-bassey-johnson, work

quote: Be always adventurous in the creating and sharing of your art in any form. Take risks and do not settle for playing safe. If you hesitate you are restraining your creativity. Some will appreciate your creative work and others will not. Just be free in expressing the creative you!
author: Alison Blackmore
tags: adventurous, creativity

quote: For a scientist must indeed be freely imaginative and yet skeptical, creative and yet a critic. There is a sense in which he must be free, but another in which his thought must be very precisely regimented; there is poetry in science, but also a lot of bookkeeping.
author: Peter Medawar, The Strange Case of the Spotted Mice: And Other Classic Essays on Science
tags: creativity, critical, imagination, poetry, science, skepticism

quote: Arts without a spiritual relative is like frying buns with water.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
tags: art, artist, arts, attune, creativity, innovation, inspiration, michael-bassey-johnson, motivation, muse, spirituality, symbolism, talent

quote: Practicing art is a meditation
author: an artwork is an insight.
tags: William   Ash

quote: Think of your passions as you do food, water, shelter...a necessity. If someone told you to give them up, would you listen?
author: Shelley K. Wall
tags: creativity, inspiration, inspirationalitude, love, motivational, passion

quote: An adversity is an opportunity to exercise and maximize your creativity.
author: Ifeanyi Enoch Onuoha
tags: creativity, ifeanyi-enoch-onuoha, motivation, opportunity, wisdom

quote: What you see is what you get. The island is imaginative enough. Creativity don’t need to be wasted on naming things.
author: Doug   Cooper
tags: addiction, cooper, creativity, identity, imagination, islands, outside-in, self-medication

quote: Creativity comes from applying things you learn in other fields to the field you work in.
author: Aaron Swartz
tags: creativity

quote: Write. Don't talk about writing. Don't tell me about your wonderful story ideas. Don't give me a bunch of 'somedays'. Plant your ass and scribble, type, keyboard. If you have any talent at all it will leak out despite your failure to pay attention in Eng
author: Glen Cook
tags: creative-process, creativity, diligence, discipline, resilience, talent, writing

quote: Creativity connects me to my truest self and vulnerability. There is nothing more personally liberating, than reaching for my face and peeling off the social mask that hides my; shadow self, pain and weakness. When i produce from this place of truth, the results transform both creator and beholder.
author: Jaeda DeWalt
tags: beholder, being-an-artist, creativity, creator, jaeda-dewalt, pain, shadow-self, social-masks, transformation, truth, vulnerability

quote: Pencil. Paper. Forget the world.
author: Shaun Hick
tags: author, creating, creative-process, creativity, paper, pencil, writing, writing-process

quote: Gratitude is a way of creativity.
author: Apollo Matrix, America: Be a Better American
tags: creativity, friendship, gratitude, inspirational, nadia-bandura, quotes-to-live-by

quote: From the outside looking in, i think my life would appear very isolated, occupying a huge empty space, with hollow-sounding, emotional echoes. But in reality, this solitary sanctuary i inhabit, allows my artistic nature to sing at the top of its lungs. My feelings have the space they need to breathe. And my art can gain the momentum, it requires, to bubble up to the surface of consciousness. For me, creativity is a chaotic and quiet hybrid, an entity that seeks a safe place to call home.
author: Jaeda DeWalt
tags: being-an-artist, being-an-introvert, creativity, jaeda-dewalt, solitude, the-creative-process

quote: Writing for the sake of writing, writing that draws its credibility from its very existence, is a foreign idea to most Americans. As a culture, we want cash on the barrel head. We want writing to earn dollars and sense so that it makes sense to us. We have a conviction—which is naive and misplaced—that being published has to do with being “good” while not being published has to do with being “amateur.” ...“Did you write today?”“Yes.”“Then you’re a writer today.”It would be lovely if being a writer were a permanent state that we could attain to. It’s not, or if it is, the permanence comes posthumously.A page at a time, a day at a time, is the way we must live our writing lives. Credibility lies in the act of writing. That is where the dignity is. That is where the final “credit” must come from.
author: Julia Cameron, The Right to Write: An Invitation and Initiation into the Writing Life
tags: creativity, credibility, writers-on-writing, writing

quote: My beauty is my eccentricity, when I am out people stare at me and speak, look at that creative guy, unique guy, different guy.
author: Amit Kalantri
tags: beautiful, beautiful-guy, beauty, beauty-of-guy, beauty-of-men, creative, creative-minds, creativity, different, eccentric, eccentricity, innovative, quotes-about-eccentricity, unique

quote: Very few managers know how to effectively tap the biggest source of performance improvement available to them: namely, the creativity and knowledge of the people who work for them.
author: Alan G. Robinson, The Idea-Driven Organization: Unlocking the Power in Bottom-Up Ideas
tags: creativity, knowledge, leadership, management, teams

quote: Art is in the eye of the beholder, and everyone will have their own interpretation.
author: E.A. Bucchianeri, Brushstrokes of a Gadfly
tags: art, art-lovers, artist, artists, arts-and-humanities, artsy, creativity, eye-of-the-beholder, humanities, interpretation, interpretation-of-art, opinion, viewpoints

quote: The more people have time to experience the joys of creativity, the less they will be consumers, especially of mass-produced culture. I see that as a kind of new wealth that counts for more than owning material things. I also see art as something people will do rather than consume, and do it as a natural part of their lives; creative endeavors are a form of profound spiritual satisfaction.
author: Theodore Roszak
tags: art, consumerism, creativity, culture, makers, spiritual-satisfaction

quote: Creativity is a gift each one of us is born with, irrespective of our backgrounds and entitlement of culture, The challenge is to hold onto this gift as we go through life. To nurture it. To encourage it. Because every single day we encounter forces that would rather it went away.
tags: art, artists, cinema, creativity, filmmaking

quote: An entrepreneur is a leader of excellence, trailblazer and pioneer who constantly brings change to their generation.
author: Onyi Anyado
tags: branding, creativity, entrepreurship, innovation, leadership

quote: Good" now is better than "Best" never.
author: Phillip Gary Smith, HARMONIZING: Keys to Living in the Song of Life
tags: creativity, development, discovery, doing, inspirational, outlook, research, writing

quote: Mistress Creation keeps calling my name... i long for her, and she, for me... we will be reunited soon. In the interim, i bide my time dreaming of her, writing about her and stretching her across the vast landscape of my imagination. "Soon", i whisper to her, "Soon
author: Jaeda DeWalt
tags: being-an-artist, creativity, inspiration, jaeda-dewalt, mistress-creation, muses, poetic, the-yearning-to-create

quote: The field of scientific abstraction encompasses independent kingdoms of ideas and of experiments and within these, rulers whose fame outlasts the centuries. But they are not the only kings in science. He also is a king who guides the spirit of his contemporaries by knowledge and creative work, by teaching and research in the field of applied science, and who conquers for science provinces which have only been raided by craftsmen.
author: Fritz Haber
tags: abstraction, applied-science, creativity, ideas, king, knowledge, nobel-laureate, research, science, scientific-abstraction

quote: One of the most connective things we can do for ourselves, is to become world travelers of our own internal landscapes. What i love about creating art, is the excitement of turning that landscape inside out for all to see. And the kind of courage that takes, when i don't know what the outcome will be...
author: Jaeda DeWalt
tags: being-an-introvert, creating-art, creativity, inspirational, internal-landscapes, jaeda-dewalt, poetic, world-traveler

quote: If there’s a single idea I emphasize when people ask about writing, it’s that there’s no right way to produce a book. But I do think that whatever you do, you should do regularly, whether it’s waking up at midnight and drinking vodka or waking up at dawn and drinking tea, whether it’s sitting in a monkish study or writing on the back of a flatbed truck. The analogy I like is children’s literature: in a lot of children’s books, there’s a huge institutional structure (Hogwarts, for example) whose presiding safety allows the children’s imagination to run free. The more consistent your habits are – and this ties into having your tools nailed down – the more secure your brain will be to run free and create.
author: Charles Finch
tags: creativity, routine, writing

quote: That's it! Stretch way beyond your perceived limitations..Go for yours like you own it already, because you truly do.
author: Sereda Aleta Dailey, The Magnificent Weight Loss System
tags: creativity, goals, inspiration, life-lessons, motivation, no-limits, weight-loss

quote: It is in everyone's interest that every person's creative genius be encouraged and allowed to develop and express.
author: Efiong Etuk, Great Insights on Human Creativity: Transforming the Way We Live, Work, Educate, Lead, and Relate
tags: creativity, genius, mass-creativity

quote: Novel writing is World Building & Word Weaving (Neil Postman's terms).
author: J.M. Varner
tags: creativity, imagination, power-of-words, words, writing

quote: Nothing is more memorable than truth beautifully told.
author: Rick Julian
tags: branding, creativity, rick-julian, wisdom

quote: Life of scarcity teaches creativity.
author: Jag Randhawa
tags: attitude, creativity, innovation

quote: Creativity is the ability to produce ideas that are both original and valuable.
author: Gerard Puccio
tags: creativity, originality, valuable

quote: When you cease to fear your solitude, a new creativity awakens in you. Your forgotten or neglected wealth begins to reveal itself. You come home to yourself and learn to rest within. Thoughts are our inner senses. Infused with silence and solitude, they bring out the mystery of inner landscape.
author: John O'Donohue, Anam Cara: A Book of Celtic Wisdom
tags: creativity, self-awareness, solitude, thoughts

quote: It is widely believed that interpersonal relationships of an intimate kind are the chief, if not the only, source of human happiness. Yet the lives of creative individuals often seem to run counter to this assumption.
author: Anthony Storr, Solitude: A Return to the Self
tags: creativity, happiness, relationships, solitude

quote: It is wrong to assume that art needs the spectator in order to be. The film runs on without any eyes. The spectator cannot exist without it. It insures his existence.
author: Jim Morrison, The Lords and the New Creatures
tags: art, creativity

quote: Because the essence of creativity is fucking around
author: art is that which is done for the hell of it.
tags: Tim Kreider, We Learn Nothing

quote: One reason that people have artist’s block is that they do not respect the law of dormancy in nature. Trees don’t produce fruit all year long, constantly. They have a point where they go dormant. And when you are in a dormant period creatively, if you can arrange your life to do the technical tasks that don’t take creativity, you are essentially preparing for the spring when it will all blossom again.
author: Marshall Vandruff
tags: art, creativity, life

quote: It's a wonderful paradox: only when you have a changeless sense of who you are, can real changes take place. It is the ground of your absolute value and everything that is truly worthwhile.
author: Ilchi Lee, Change: Realizing Your Greatest Potential
tags: creativity, habits, love, self-development, transformation-spirituality

quote: For you to make your creative work creative, you must seek creativity from the creator.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
tags: blessing, contemplation, create, creative, creativity, creator, god, idea, inner-eye, innovation, inspirational, knock, meditation, metamorphosis, michael-bassey-johnson, mystification, other-world, out-of-the-body, power, prayer, prayers, seek, seeker, soul, source, spirit, third-eye, yoga

quote: You have to nourish your creativity for it to flourish...
author: Kat Von D., Go Big or Go Home: Taking Risks in Life, Love, and Tattooing
tags: creativity, inspirational

quote: Creativity is key to productivity and prosperity.
author: Ifeanyi Enoch Onuoha
tags: advancement, africa, america, betterment, change, creativity, development, gdp, growth, ifeanyi-enoch-onuoha, key, nigeria, production, productivity

quote: The show must go on, and so must The Book.
author: E.A. Bucchianeri
tags: arts-and-humanities, books, creative-people, creative-process, creativity, novels, perseverance, reading, twitter-quotes, writers-on-writing, writers-quotes, writing, writing-advice, writing-advice-process

quote: If you're a writer, the problem is that, when you try to call a halt to thinking about your novel-in-progress, your imagination still keeps going; you can't shut it off.
author: John Irving, A Widow for One Year
tags: creativity, writing

quote: The framing of a problem is often far more essential than its solution
author: Albert Einstein
tags: creativity, problem-solving, thinking-differently

quote: Zombies are familiar characters in philosophical thought experiments. They are like people in every way except they have no internal experience.... If there are enough zombies recruited into our world, I worry about the potential for a self-fulfilling prophecy. Maybe if people pretend they are not conscious or do not have free will - or that the cloud of online people is a person; if they pretend there is nothing special about the perspective of the individual - then perhaps we have the power to make it so. We might be able to collectively achieve antimagic. Humans are free. We can commmit suicide for the benefit of a Singularity. We can engineer our genes to better support an imaginary hive mind. We can make culture and journalism into second-rate activities and spend centuries remixing the detritus of the 1960s and other eras from before individual creativity went out of fashion. Or we can believe in ourselves. By chance, it might turn out we are real.
author: Jaron Lanier, You Are Not a Gadget
tags: creativity, culture, experience, free-will, freedom, individuality, journalism, philosophy, singularity, technology, thought-experiments, zombies

quote: Let the systematic theologian spell it out. Let the artists throw out thoughts and slants, maybe even slants no one else has thought of. They should give another view of something familiar to help us learn more about it. They should deal with love, life, good, evil, God, the world and faith. Many of the biblical writers were poets more than they were theologians. Poets and prophets ranted and raved, and storytellers wrote great yarns that all had different slants on God and life and faith. Perhaps the poet's absence from the Church for many centuries has left it deprived of much insight.
author: Steve Stockman
tags: art, bible, communication, creativity, imagery, style

quote: Creativity is the ability to introduce order into the randomness of nature.
author: Eric Hoffer
tags: creativity, nature, order, randomness

quote: Symbols,” Langdon said, “in no way confirm the presence of their original creators.
author: Dan Brown, Angels & Demons
tags: confirm, creations, creativity, creators, original, symbology, symbols

quote: you cannot teach art—you cannot make a soul
author: John Geddes
tags: art, creativity, vision

quote: Everyone worked day and night, Monday through Saturday. Oppenheimer insisted people take Sundays off to rest and recharge. Scientists fished for trout in nearby streams, or climbed mountains and discussed physics while watching the sunrise. "This is how many discoveries were made," one scientist said.
author: Steve Sheinkin, Bomb: The Race to Build—and Steal—the World's Most Dangerous Weapon
tags: creativity, discoveries, nature, problem-solving, rest, sundays, world-war-2

quote: He had entered another imaginative world, one connected to the beginning of his life as a writer, to the Napoleonic world that had been a lifelong metaphor for the power of art, for the empire of his own creation He began to dictate notes for a new novel, "fragments of the book he imagines himself to be writing." As if he were now writing a novel of which his own altered consciousness was the dramatic center, he dictated a vision of himself as Napoleon and his own family as the Imperial Bonapartes....William and Alice he grasped with his regent hand, addressing his 'dear and most esteemed brother and sister.' To them, to whom he had granted countries, he now gave the responsibility of supervising the detailed plans he had created for 'the decoration of certain apartments, here of the Louvre and Tuileries, which you will find addressed in detail to artists and workment who take them in hand.' He was himself the 'imperial e
author: Fred Kaplan, Henry James: The Imagination of Genius, A Biography
tags: art, creativity, death, delirium, hallucination, imagination, language, novel-writing, novelists, sentence-structure, syntax, writing

quote: The world is changing rapidly, and everyone changes along with the world. Discoveries is now becoming rampant; intellectually, technologically,etc, each having its advantage and disadvantage.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
tags: advantage, age, bearing-fruits, change, changing, computer, computer-age, computers, creative, creativity, disadvantage, discoveries, discovery, end-time, epoch, era, fast, fast-changing-world, fruitful, fruits, increase, intellect, jet-age, knowledge, make-hay-while-sun-shines, metamorphosis, michael-bassey-johnson, multiply, multiplying, technology, the-end-of-the-world, the-great-change, the-world, world

quote: He was humbled by her infinite love toward him - it shone through even in his afterlife.
author: H. L. Balcomb
tags: afterlife, creativity, credere, divinity, dream, h-l-balcomb, heaven, love, now, positivity, prayer, prayers

quote: after life has broken you open, perhaps you may create art
author: John Geddes
tags: creativity, experience, pain, writing

quote: Failure taught him that he could have made the right choice. I could have tried.
author: H. L. Balcomb
tags: afterlife, creativity, dream, forgiveness, heaven, hope, hopeful, love, now, peace

quote: The flowers' beauty drew her closer to them like a magnetic force. She felt compelled to walk a little faster.
author: H. L. Balcomb
tags: afterlife, beauty, creativity, dream, flowers, hope, magnetic, now, positivity, possibility, purpose

quote: ...the imagination works not so much through inspiration as through perseverance. One must slog through the false starts, spot the wrong words and hold out for the right ones, and above all, be vigilant about staying on the path of revision, no matter how uncomfortable or even painful the journey might become.
author: Kathleen Norris, The Virgin of Bennington
tags: creativity, poetry, writing

quote: Burn the book. It serves you once.Read the book. Serves you for a lifetime.Lend the book. It serves for generations to come.
author: Kowtham Kumar K
tags: creativity, life, reading

quote: The anthology was not a best-seller
author: art as a weapon seldom is.
tags: Lyle Wesley Dorsett, Surprised by Love: Her Life and Marriage to C.S. Lewis

quote: Never regret losing time on reading good books
author: Kowtham Kumar K
tags: creativity, imagination, reading

quote: I am no longer scared to close my eyes and to imagine.
author: Vijay Bagha
tags: creativity, inspirational, life, life-lessons

quote: It thanked her for the life she breathed into hits being; without her influence, this little being would not have been in the Garden of Glory.
author: H. L. Balcomb
tags: afterlife, creativity, divinity, dream, garden, glory, hope, life, love, now, possibility, purpose

quote: The grand scheme of a life, maybe (just maybe), is not about knowing or not knowing, choosing or not choosing. Perhaps what is truly known can’t be described or articulated by creativity or logic, science or art — but perhaps it can be described by the most authentic and meaningful combination of the two: poetry: As Robert Frost wrote, a poem 'begins as a lump in the throat, a sense of wrong, a homesickness, a lovesickness. It is never a thought to begin with.'I recommend the following course of action for those who are just beginning their careers or for those like me, who may be reconfiguring midway through: heed the words of Robert Frost. Start with a big, fat lump in your throat, start with a profound sense of wrong, a deep homesickness, or a crazy lovesickness, and run with it.
author: Debbie Millman, Look Both Ways: Illustrated Essays on the Intersection of Life and Design
tags: career, creativity, life, love, robert-frost

quote: I see a creative process as a necessarily thievish undertaking. Dig beneath a beautiful piece of writing, Monsieur Boustouler, and you will find all manner of dishonor. Creating means vandalizing the lives of other people, turning them into unwilling and unwitting participants. You steal their desires, their dreams, pocket their flaws, their suffering. You take what does not belong to you. You do this knowingly.
author: Khaled Hosseini, And the Mountains Echoed
tags: creativity, writing

quote: If a creative person steals your idea, he’s killing his creative ability, if he steals your art, he’s killing his art, if he makes it available to the world, it won,t create de impact you could have created, because it wasn’t from the right source.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
tags: beware-of-fraudsters, copyright, creative, creativity, imitation, it-is-in-you, liars, no-peace-for-the-devil, nobody-can-steal-and-go-free, piracy, source, stealing, the-mind, the-power-will-die, thiefs

quote: The working artist will not tolerate trouble in her life because she knows trouble prevents her from doing her work. The working artist banishes from her world all sources of trouble. She harnesses the urge for trouble and transforms it in her work.
author: Steven Pressfield, The War of Art: Break Through the Blocks & Win Your Inner Creative Battles
tags: art, artists, creativity, trouble

quote: Society's goal is to make us less foolish. From the cradle to grave the pressure is on: "Be normal!" Our inner fool may be shackled and caged by a world made to suppress it, but Jesus came to free the fool.
author: Mark Batterson, In a Pit with a Lion on a Snowy Day: How to Survive and Thrive When Opportunity Roars
tags: creativity, reputation, stigma

quote: Writers are not just writers, they are creators of worlds, sculptors of the mind, they are architects of language.
author: Jamie L. Harding
tags: architects, books, creativity, language, literature, reading, writer, writers, writing

quote: The value of an artist is more because of his originality than his skill.
author: Amit Kalantri
tags: art, artist, artistic, artists, arts, creative, creativity, original, originality

quote: Flair is what makes the difference between artistry and mere competence. Cmdr. William Riker
author: Star Trek The Next Generation
tags: artistry, creativity, flair, individuality, style

quote: A very serious mental disorder is associated with creativity, a disorder that afflicts only the great souls, and its cure is not known, even to the great souls”.
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
tags: creativity, great-souls, greatness, insanity, powerful-people

quote: It takes courage to be creative. Just as soon as you have an idea, you become a minority of one.
author: E. Paul Torrance
tags: creativity, ideas, loneliness

quote: wear your treasure and you will be Treasured
author: Treasure Stitches
tags: beauty, clothe, creativity, elegance, fashion, love

quote: Producing works of art doesn't often count as appropriate intellectual work in an arts department: yet the equivalent in a science department, doing physics or chemistry, does. So why is it that in universities writing about novels is thought to be a higher intellectual calling than writing novels; or rather, if writing novels is not thought to be intellectually valid, why is writing about them?
author: Ken Robinson, Out of Our Minds: Learning to Be Creative
tags: art, creativity, writing

quote: An idea is like a spark to creativity, which turns to a wild conflagration of thoughts, burning every ignorance. When the fire burns, the creative power is awake, and comes out to join the ideas in your head to bring out the hidden valuables the world never knew
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
tags: ability, brainy, creative-forces, creativity, fires-of-knowledge, idea, inspiration, inspirational, meditation, powerful-forces, reflection, talent, thoughts

quote: Unless social sciences can be as creative as natural science, our new tools are not likely to be of much use to us.
author: Edgar Douglas Adrian
tags: creativity, natural-science, nobel-laureate, science, social-science, tools, use

quote: It is not commercial success but originality and proof of autonomy which are admired.
author: Angela Phillips
tags: autonomy, commercial, creativity, inpirational, journalism, success

quote: Discovery's friend is creativity
author: Phillip Gary Smith, HARMONIZING: Keys to Living in the Song of Life
tags: creativity, discovery, invention, life, poetry, thought, writing

quote: Who cares for Algebra?Who delights in solving math?I only want to live my lifeAlong the creative path.
author: Jennifer Niven, The Aqua Net Diaries: Big Hair, Big Dreams, Small Town
tags: creativity

quote: The human eye is restricted to see the useen, because there’s a price to be paid to the rulers of this image and if this image is seen by you, you’ll dare not divulge it to others, for others must pay a price
author: Michael Bassey Johnson
tags: creative, creativity, debt, famous, give-out-and-take-in, pay-a-price, pay-your-bills, rich, sources, the-rulers-of-creativity, the-unseen-images, wealth, your-source

quote: Appreciate the aesthetic and creativity of the nature and be grateful for being part of it.
author: M.F. Moonzajer
tags: aesthetics, appreciate, creativity, grateful, nature

quote: The aesthetic construct, and nothing else, has taught us to expose ourselves to a non-enslaving experience of rank differences. The work of art is even allowed to 'tell' us, those who have run away from form, something, because it quite obviously does not embody the intention to confine us. 'La poesie ne s'impose plus, elle s'expose' Something that exposes itself and proves itself in this test gains unpresumed authority. In the space of aesthetic simulation, which is at once the emergency space for the success and failure of the artistic construct, the powerless superiority of the works can affect observers who otherwise take pains to ensure that they have no lord, old or new, above them.
author: Peter Sloterdijk, Du mußt dein Leben ändern
tags: art, authority, creativity, poetry, rilke

quote: The novelist defines the story with the following example: If you are told that the king died and then the queen died, that is a sequence of events. If you were told that the king died and then the queen died of grief, that is a story that he was interested.
author: E.M. Forster
tags: creativity, empathy, writing

quote: Comparison is the enemy to creativity.
author: E'yen A. Gardner
tags: comparison, creativity

quote: Creativity is imagining something that isn't there and making it real.
author: Spencer Wells, Pandora's Seed: The Unforeseen Cost of Civilization
tags: creativity

quote: The proliferation of creative power can transform the world for all of its inhabitants.
author: Timothy Simpson, Boredom to Brilliance
tags: arts, boredom, brilliance, creativity, music, transformation

quote: So many important New York musicians were gay, one wit dubbed the American Composers League the Homintern.
author: Charles Kaiser, The Gay Metropolis: The Landmark History of Gay Life in America since World War II
tags: creativity, gay, homosexual, musicians

quote: I don't get writers block. I get writer has too many ideas and doesn't know which one to start next, block.
author: Tyler Hojberg
tags: art, creativity, writer-s-block, writing

quote: Its funny to see how creativity is used to satiate a misplaced libido. How it shifts from an extension of who you are to a bait of what/how much you can get.
author: Nikhil Sharda, Sans Destination
tags: creativity, libido-issues

quote: Insanity is coasting through life in a miserable existence when you have a caged lion locked inside and the key to release it.
author: Morgan Freeman
tags: creativity, imagination, life, originality

quote: Everyone wants a definition of creativity that makes what they do into something special and what everyone else does into nothing special. But the fact is, we're all creative. We come up with weird and interesting ideas all the time. The biggest difference between 'creators' isn't their imagination - it's how hard they work. Ideas are easy. Doing stuff is hard.
author: Cory Doctorow, Pirate Cinema
tags: creativity

quote: Up until relatively recently, creating original characters from scratch wasn't a major part of an author's job description. When Virgil wrote The Aeneid, he didn't invent Aeneas; Aeneas was a minor character in Homer's Odyssey whose unauthorized further adventures Virgil decided to chronicle. Shakespeare didn't invent Hamlet and King Lear; he plucked them from historical and literary sources. Writers weren't the originators of the stories they told; they were just the temporary curators of them. Real creation was something the gods did.All that has changed. Today the way we think of creativity is dominated by Romantic notions of individual genius and originality, and late-capitalist concepts of intellectual property, under which artists are businesspeople whose creations are the commodities they have for sale.
author: Lev Grossman
tags: creativity, originality

quote: Magic is not just for the entertainment, but to inspire people to be creative enough with their lives.
author: Amit Kalantri
tags: art, artist, artistry, artists, creative, creativity, illusion, illusions, inspiration, inspirational, inspire, magic, magical, magician, magicians

quote: How often have the greatest thoughts and ideas come to light during conversations with the family over the evening dinner?
author: E.A. Bucchianeri
tags: arts-and-humanities, conversation, creative-people, creativity, dinner, discovery, discussions, family, family-dinner, food, ideas, inspiration, inspirations, meals-mealtimes, sharing-ideas, sources-of-inspiration, thoughts, wisdom, writing

quote: Life's a maze, you twist and you turn through itThe driest of droughts, maneuvered and I earned through it
author: Clipse
tags: creativity, intuition, rap, resilience, something-from-nothing

quote: The simple everyday experiences become the doorway to new thoughts and inspirations.
author: E.A. Bucchianeri
tags: arts-and-humanities, creative-people, creativity, experiences, ideas, inspiration, original-thoughts, simple-things, simple-things-of-life, sources-of-inspiration, thoughts, writing

quote: Creativity doesn’t come from glancing quickly at your Twitter feed while in line at Starbucks. It comes from deep thought. It comes from voraciously reading books—long books that require focused attention. It comes from meaningful discourse with other intellectually curious people. It comes from listening and asking good questions.
author: Joshua Rogers
tags: books, creativity, investing

quote: Erudition is the crude residue of wilted harvests
author: wit: the meddlesome weed that wilts them.
tags: Ashim Shanker

quote: I say making movies is like eating a sandwich of shit. Sometimes you get more bread, sometimes less bread, but you always get shit." (Guardian interview 2006)
author: Guillermo del Toro
tags: creativity, movie-making

quote: Trying to think more outside the box is like taking a picture with a camera, the more you do it, the more you learn about different positions and angles. The more you take pictures, the more you learn that you can change the camera distance range or change the speeds, and different amounts of light let in. Likewise, the camera speed is the same as allowing yourself time for outside ideas and thoughts to flow.
author: Wes Adamson
tags: creativity, outside-the-box

quote: Nothing kills creativity so well as a big dose of negativity.
author: Stella Payton
tags: better-life-with-stella, creativity, negativity, stella-payton

quote: (reporter interviewing Broadway dancer Tommy Tune:) 'Do you think that greats like Fred Astaire possessed some kind of magic?'(pause)'No. Magic possesses them'.
author: Tommy Tune, Astaire: The Man, the Dancer
tags: artistry, creativity, magic, persona, star-power, talent

quote: One of the few things I know about writing is this:spend it all, shoot it, play it, lose it, right away, every time. Do not hoard what seems good for a later place in the book, or for another book; give it, give it all, give it now. The impulse to save something good for a better place later is a signal to spend it now. Something more will arise later, something better. These things fill from behind, from beneath, like well water.
author: Annie Dillard, The Writing Life
tags: creativity, on-writing, on-writing-a-book, writing-life

quote: the battle for our culture must be waged at the level of the imagination.
author: Eric Metaxas
tags: creativity, imagination, persuasion

quote: Artistry, perhaps, is at its core being able to control change in interesting ways.
author: Jeff Ryan
tags: art, artistry, changes, creativity, originality, thinking, unique

quote: I’ve had a fountain pen surgically implanted in my left index finger to save trouble. My body is tattooed with line upon line of truth, fiction, and a not-always-pleasing mix of the two.
author: Chila Woychik, On Being a Rat and Other Observations
tags: creativity, on-being-a-rat, rats, writing, writing-life, writing-process

quote: I suck the words word-dryto me, assimilated orderly at breakeye speedstill hard and hardersofter thenline-lined book-dry‘til not a dropof water-bloodfrom oak and elmand authored menis left to whisper“Read…
author: Chila Woychik, On Being a Rat and Other Observations
tags: creativity, on-being-a-rat, poetry-about-writing, reading, writing, writing-life, writing-process

quote: When I pour a bowl of Uncle Sam’s cereal, I never know if I should stand when I eat, salute it first, or simply hum the Star Spangled Banner between mouthfuls.
author: Chila Woychik, On Being a Rat and Other Observations
tags: creativity, on-being-a-rat, writing, writing-life, writing-process

quote: Split your skull—a hatchet works well enough. Take a more delicate instrument—a scalpel, perhaps—and make a hand-sized slit; it doesn’t matter where. Reach in (no glove needed), plunge down to the very bottom, pinch the inside layer of membrane and yank, hard. If it feels like you’ve just turned your brain inside out, you have. Writing is brain surgery, pure and simple.
author: Chila Woychik, On Being a Rat and Other Observations
tags: creativity, hard-writing, on-being-a-rat, writing, writing-is-work, writing-life, writing-process

quote: When you write by hand, you don't have the excessive freedom of a computer. When I write down something, I have to be serious about it. I have to ask myself, "Is this necessary at this point in the book?
author: Pat Conroy
tags: creativity, redolence, technology, writing

quote: You have to pay for this view (onto which he looks while writing), so our expenses keep us pretty motivated to write. It's a vicious cycle.
author: Pat Conroy
tags: creativity, jobs, materialism, motivation, vocation

quote: Creation, in all its forms, is where I find beauty. If I could travel as far outward as I have inward, I would know with the utmost conviction that distance does not exist.
author: L.A. Rosenberg
tags: creativity, inspirational, introspective

quote: This piece of earth I billet grows small. Bullets of time dart past, dropping shards of opportunity at my feet. And until the rift that surrounds my decaying body clamps shut—swallows me up like so many remains—I army on, simultaneously ignoring and saving my comrades in the hole.Such is a writer’s life.
author: Chila Woychik, On Being a Rat and Other Observations
tags: creativity, on-being-a-rat, rats, writing, writing-life, writing-process

quote: The genius craves inspiration: she craves altered states and fresh perceptions. She will have them either through evolving closer to the divine or through devolving lower into the world. This is how some people with great genius come to die of drug and alcohol addiction: they seek inspiration by intoxication and are thereby ruined.
author: Carolyn Elliott, Awaken Your Genius: A Seven-Step Path to Freeing Your Creativity and Manifesting Your Dreams
tags: creativity, genius, self-help

quote: The role of your genius spirit is to essentially heal, transform, and evolve consciousness.
author: Carolyn Elliott, Awaken Your Genius: A Seven-Step Path to Freeing Your Creativity and Manifesting Your Dreams
tags: creativity, self-help, wisdom

quote: ...“Maybe it’s like this, Max--you know how, when you are working on a long and ordered piece, all sorts of bright and lovely ideas and images intrude. They have no place in what you are writing, and so if you are young, you write them in a notebook for future use. And you never use them because they are sparkling and alive like colored pebbles on a wave-washed shore. It’s impossible not to fill your pockets with them. But when you get home, they are dry and colorless. I’d like to pin down a few while they are still wet.”...'John Steinbeck
author: John Steinbeck
tags: creativity

quote: Remember that your fans are your lifeblood. See that you know who they are, and give them a reason to follow you. Be sure to thank them, often, for caring enough to support you. They’re responsible for your success just as much as you are.
author: Simon Zingerman, We All Need Heroes: Stories of the Brave and Foolish
tags: art, business, creativity, feel-good, good-hearted, goodness, hero, heroes, hope, inspiration, inspirational, life, marketing, philosophy, simon-zingerman, success, we-all-need-heroes, wisdom, zingerman

quote: I think if you study--if you learn too much of what others have done, you may tend to take the same direction as everybody else.
author: Jim Henson, It's Not Easy Being Green: And Other Things to Consider
tags: creativity, innovation, learning, studying

quote: I’m an author. We don’t want to lead. We don’t need to follow. We stay home and make stuff up and write it down and send it out into the world, and get inside people’s heads. Perhaps we change the world and perhaps we don’t. We never know. We just make stuff up.
author: Neil Gaiman
tags: authors, books, creativity, gaiman, neil-gaiman, tumblr, writing, writing-advice, writing-books, writing-life

quote: I can very well do without God both in my life and in my painting, but I cannot, suffering as I am, do without something which is greater than I, which is my life, the power to create.
author: Vincent van Gogh, The Letters of Vincent van Gogh
tags: create, creativity, greatness, meaning, painting, power, suffering

quote: In one of the Upanishads it says, when the glow of a sunset holds you and you say 'Aha,' that is the recognition of the divinity. And when you say 'Aha' to an art object, that is a recognition of divinity. And what divinity is it? It is your divinity, which is the only divinity there is. We are all phenomenal manifestations of a divine will to live, and that will and the consciousness of life is one in all of us, and that is what artwork expresses.
author: Joseph Campbell, The Mythic Dimension: Selected Essays 1959-87
tags: art, consciousness, creativity, divinity, life

quote: Ever afterward, though the dance of creation change around me in the hall of eternity, I shall be the same.
author: Anandamayi Ma
tags: bliss, creativity, infinite

quote: Creativity is more than just being different. Anybody can play weird-- that's easy. What's hard is to be as simple as Bach. Making the simple complicated is commonplace--making the complicated simple, awesomely simple--that's creativity.
author: Charles Mingus
tags: creativity

quote: Entrepreneurship is when an individual retrieves a red hot idea from the creativity furnace without the constraint of the heat of lean resources, and with each persistent blow of the innovation hammer shapes the still malleable idea against the anvil of passion, vision, insight, strategy, and principles to forge a fitting vessel of a creative concern.
author: Amah Lambert, Cracking the Stock Market Code: How to Make Money in Shares
tags: assets, business, creativity, entrepreneurship, growth, ideas, income, innovation, inspirational, investing, markets

quote: The willingness to be a champion for stupid ideas is the key to greater creativity, innovation, fulfillment, inspiration, motivation and success.
author: Richie Norton, The Power of Starting Something Stupid: How to Crush Fear, Make Dreams Happen, and Live without Regret
tags: art, create, creative, creativity, fear, fulfillment, heart, inherent, innovation, inspiration, key, leaning-into-fear, motivation, risk, stupid, stupid-idea, success

quote: Computers are quiet and clean and totally distracting because the Internet is there, lying in wait for a moment of weakness to pounce on your creativity and progress.
author: Arlaina Tibensky, And Then Things Fall Apart
tags: computers, creativity, distraction, internet

quote: Perhaps the most powerful and appealing aspect of another's words, however, is simply their convenience. Whether distilled in the briefest apophthegm, or spread out across some voluminous tome, the thought is ready-made, the heavy lifting done. It's there to be used like a weapon or tool, and as time wanders on, seemingly leaving us fewer and fewer new things to say, it becomes ever more useful. As technology moves forward, as well, it also becomes much easier. Indeed, in this "information age" where so much is available to so many so quickly that enlightenment nearly verges on light pollution, it can sometimes appear that expression has been reduced to nothing more than a mad race to unearth and claim references. As such, the citation is also there to be donned, like some article of fashion from which we may reap the praise of discriminating taste without ever exerting ourself in the actual toil of manufacture.
author: Jasper Siegel Seneschal, Citations: A Brief Anthology
tags: citation, creativity, expression, quotation, quotations

quote: Imagination is the faculty of the mind that God has given us to make the communication of his beauty beautiful.
author: John Piper
tags: art, beauty, christianity, creativity, god, imagination, john-piper

quote: Despite being a denizen of the digital world, or maybe because he knew all too well its isolating potential, Jobs was a strong believer in face to face meetings. " There's a temptation in our networked age to think that ideas can be developed by email and iChat,"he said."Thats crazy, Creativity comes from spontaneous meetings, from random discussions. You run into someone, you ask what they're doing, you say ' Wow, and soon your cooking up all sorts of ideas." So he had the Pixar building planned to promote encounters and unplanned collaborations. " If a building doesn't encourage that, you'll lose a lot of innovation and the magic that's sparked by serendipity,"he said.
author: Walter Isaacson, Steve Jobs
tags: business-culture, collaboration, creativity, networking

quote: Unnecessary bureaucracy hinders creativity, growth, justice and the attainment of peace.
author: Widad Akreyi
tags: creativity, growth, inspirational-quote, justice, non-violence, peace

quote: While friends are there to motivate us and keep us pleased. Our enemies are there to annoy us, which makes us work harder to beat them.
author: Simon Zingerman, We All Need Heroes: Stories of the Brave and Foolish
tags: art, business, creativity, feel-good, good-hearted, goodness, hero, heroes, hope, inspiration, inspirational, life, marketing, philosophy, simon-zingerman, success, we-all-need-heroes, wisdom, zingerman

quote: Creativity is not any accumulated knowledge, coming from past to the present. The stage of creation is a spontaneous flash of intelligence, Energy merging with mind, to create a new beginning. Creativity and meditation are similar, as both are expressions of something beyond mind.
author: Gian Kumar
tags: creativity

quote: Creativity is a fragile, delicate flower,which must be cautiously cared forand protected,from the harsh elementsof "human weather.
author: ELLE NICOLAI
tags: art, creativity, imagination

quote: This story inspires me to contribute with something unique and exciting for my time.
author: Simon Zingerman, We All Need Heroes: Stories of the Brave and Foolish
tags: art, business, creativity, feel-good, good-hearted, goodness, hero, heroes, hope, inspiration, inspirational, life, marketing, philosophy, simon-zingerman, success, we-all-need-heroes, wisdom, zingerman

quote: Creativity is at the heart of every stupid idea . . . creativity and stupid are interchangeable . . . because everything inherent to that kind of creativity requires breaking away from the norm, going against the grain, and leaning into risk and fear.
author: Richie Norton, The Power of Starting Something Stupid: How to Crush Fear, Make Dreams Happen, and Live without Regret
tags: art, create, creative, creativity, fear, heart, inherent, leaning-into-fear, risk, stupid, stupid-idea

quote: You are the end of beauty and creativity one must have created so far.
author: M.F. Moonzajer, A moment with God ; Poetry
tags: beauty, created, creativity, end

quote: There really is power in numbers. In today’s society one has to understand the true power of word of mouth. It’s true that the new tastemakers are us.
author: Simon Zingerman, We All Need Heroes: Stories of the Brave and Foolish
tags: art, business, creativity, feel-good, good-hearted, goodness, hero, heroes, hope, inspiration, inspirational, life, marketing, philosophy, simon-zingerman, success, we-all-need-heroes, wisdom, zingerman

quote: Stories of absurd events in life get my creative juices flowing and have so far given birth to some of my best ideas.
author: Simon Zingerman, We All Need Heroes: Stories of the Brave and Foolish
tags: art, business, creativity, feel-good, good-hearted, goodness, hero, heroes, hope, inspiration, inspirational, life, marketing, philosophy, simon-zingerman, success, we-all-need-heroes, wisdom, zingerman

quote: Creativity's too big a pill
author: the truth's too hard to swallow. Sprinkle sugar in a straight line and we'll all inhale and follow.
tags: Kelby Losack, Toxic Garbage

quote: You don't have to reinvent the wheel... just steel the hubcaps.
author: Michael P. Naughton, Deathryde: Rebel Without a Corpse
tags: creativity, originality-hollywood

quote: You know, the whole thing about perfectionism. The perfectionism is very dangerous. Because of course if your fidelity to perfectionism is too high, you never do anything. Because doing anything results in...it's actually kind of tragic because you sacrifice how gorgeous and perfect it is in your head for what it really is. And there were a couple of years where I really struggled with that.
author: David Foster Wallace
tags: beauty, creativity, fear, idealism, idealists, ideals, inertia, infp, perfection, perfection-and-confusion, perfectionism, perfectionists, writers-block

quote: My life isn't good or bad. It's an incredible series of emotional and mental extremes, with beautiful thunderstorms and stunning sunrises.Some would say this is my artistic temperament. Others would say i am mentally ill or bipolar. I SAY... it's a bit of both and i make the most of them, CREATIVELY.
author: Jaeda DeWalt
tags: artistic, bipolar, creativity, existing-in-extremes, inspirational, life, mental-illness

quote: If everyone waited to become an expert before starting, no one would become an expert. To become an EXPERT, you must have EXPERIENCE. To get EXPERIENCE, you must EXPERIMENT! Stop waiting. Start stuff.
author: Richie Norton
tags: business, create, creative, creativity, entrepreneurship, experience, experiment, expert, start, starting, stuff, wait, waiting

quote: My world is about FEELings. Sometimes, these feelings run so deep i fear i will drown.Creatively, it's a dream to be so sensitive. In real life, it's exhausting, as i tread water to keep myself from sinking.
author: Jaeda DeWalt
tags: creativity, emotions, feelings, real-life, sensitivity

quote: I just needed time alone with my own thoughtsGot treasures in my mind but couldn’t open up my own vault
author: Kanye West
tags: creative-process, creativity, thinking

quote: People talk-- they sneer at escapism. Well, there are those of us who need it.
author: Piers Anthony
tags: creativity, escapism, imagination, inspirational, life

quote: Imagination is our inner-child and creativity, its playground.
author: Jaeda DeWalt
tags: creativity, imagination, inner-child, inspirational, playground

quote: Art gives those unexpressed parts of ourselves permission to be felt and spoken.
author: Jaeda DeWalt
tags: art, creativity, inspirational, self-expression

quote: Sanity is transmuting all the insane parts of your brain into a creative outlet.
author: Jaeda DeWalt
tags: creativity, insane, insanity, inspirational, sanity

quote: Nestled in the valley of darkness, in the deepest depths of depression, are the priceless gems of; creativity, intuition and sensitivity. The trick is learning how to navigate the dark, so these precious gems can be unearthed and their beauty beheld.
author: Jaeda DeWalt
tags: creativity, depression, inspirational, mental-illness, wisdom, wise-words

quote: I would follow in your footsteps if I wasn't so busy making my own.
author: Truth Devour, Wantin
tags: creativity, footsteps, independence

quote: A blank cheque kills creativity.
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana, The Confessions of a Misfit
tags: constraints, creativity

quote: My art is largely made up of my pain; re-framed, redesigned and re-purposed. It's a mutually beneficial experience for both the creator and the beholder. Transformative healing is a beautiful process.
author: Jaeda DeWalt
tags: creativity, healing-through-art, inspirational, pain, self-expression, transformation

quote: The creative process is a love story that never ends. The ideas are like suitors competing for your attention. You may have relationships, with multiple ideas, at once. You may devote yourself completely to one idea, for a awhile, but the affairs will never end. There will always be more ideas to romance and more concepts to develop. And all for that wonderful moment when you get to gaze at the complete creation and hold perfection in your arms, for one blissful moment... before your inner-critic starts tearing it to shreds.
author: Jaeda DeWalt
tags: being-an-artist, creativity, funny, humor, inspirational, passion, sarcasm, the-creative-process, wit

quote: The art of writing is not as solitary as one might think. When it finally dawns on us one day that our task as writers is to share what we know of the human spirit, we suddenly discover that we were never truly alone.
author: Hal Zina Bennett, Write from the Heart: Unleashing the Power of Your Creativity
tags: creativity, human-spirit, solitary, writing, writing-process

quote: Someday, i dream we will medically address mental illness in a way that helps people WITHOUT completely crippling them, creatively or robbing them of their precious sensitivity. No one wants to live life feeling like they underwent a chemical lobotomy, that is not living. And, "Normal" needs a much broader definition... perhaps we could just replace that word with, "harmonious living.
author: Jaeda DeWalt
tags: creativity, harmonious-living, hope, mental-illness

quote: Art invites us to become explorers and excavators of our vast internal landscapes, discovering new terrain and digging deep into the past to unearth forgotten experiences and emotion.
author: Jaeda DeWalt
tags: art, artistic-expression, being-creative, creativity, inspirational

quote: Today, the world rewards those with creative and intellectual muscles. So, women and skinny men need to shut up and start thinking.
author: Mokokoma Mokhonoana, The Confessions of a Misfit
tags: creativity, hard-labor, ideas, intellect

quote: You can’t let fear and indecision sink your creativity—they do not easily release their hold.
author: Richie Norton, The Power of Starting Something Stupid: How to Crush Fear, Make Dreams Happen, and Live without Regret
tags: business, creative, creative-process, creative-thinking, creative-work, creativity, fear, fearless

quote: Writing keeps death at bay. Every book I write is a triumph over death. ... If we did not know we’d die, we’d wander around and sleep like cats.
author: Ray Bradbury
tags: creativity, death, inspirational, motivation, writing

quote: I don't create my images as visual equations to be solved, but rather, i create them as internal landscapes that the viewer can explore. I enjoy sharing the why behind the what, of my creations... but my way, isn't the only way, to experience them. There is no correct way to interpret them. Perception is reality and yours may be different from mine and that's okay.
author: Jaeda DeWalt
tags: art, being-an-artist, creativity, internal-landscapes, perception, the-creative-process, visual-equations

quote: When I stay in one Place, I can hardly think at all; my body had to be on the move to set my mind going." Jean-Jacques Rousseau.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau
tags: creativity

quote: Live life with creative purpose.
author: Truth Devour, Wantin
tags: creativity, life-and-living

quote: It’s my opinion that only in times of utter depression or lofty peace is it appropriate to be creative.
author: Nicholas Trandahl
tags: creativity

quote: If you cannot create, then buy a company that can. In particular, the large corporations buy small, personnally owned companies that have made breakthroughs in particular areas. They are buying creativity, though the immediate rush this produces doesn't last long. Once integrated into an administrative atmosphere, the creativity is sucked out of them.(IV - From Managers and Speculators to Growth)
author: John Ralston Saul, The Unconscious Civilization
tags: creativity

quote: You want to create a country with millions of great magicians? Then let the free thinking prevails everywhere. And thus creativity will increase and creativity is the greatest magician in our universe.
author: Mehmet Murat ildan
tags: creativity

quote: As a society we should try to never inhibit another person's creativity. In people like myself, it's all we have.
author: Michael Houbrick
tags: celebrities, creativity, hollywood, houbrick, inspiration, the-rat-pack-of-hollywood

quote: For if u have positive attitude n creativeness u will always see a graveyard as a beautiful garden...
author: Sana
tags: creativity, positiveness

quote: Stare. It is the way to educate your eye, and more. Stare, pry, listen, eavesdrop. Die knowing something. You are not here long.
author: Walker Evans
tags: art, creativity, photography

quote: Nolan Bushnell, the creator of the Atari video game system, once stated, ‘Everyone who’s ever taken a shower has had an idea, It’s the person who gets out of the shower, dries off, and does something about it who makes a difference.
author: Mark Batterson, Draw the Circle: The 40 Day Prayer Challenge
tags: creativity, faith, god, writing-life

quote: Everything in the world was about creativity: belief and creation. Storytelling was the essence of both.
author: Alethea Kontis, Enchanted
tags: alethea-kontis, creativity, enchanted, storytelling

quote: Because it is possible to create — creating one’s self, willing to be one’s self, as well as creating in all the innumerable daily activities (and these are two phases of the same process) — one has anxiety. One would have no anxiety if there were no possibility whatever. Now creating, actualizing one’s possibilities, always involves negative as well as positive aspects. It always involves destroying the status quo, destroying old patterns within oneself, progressively destroying what one has clung to from childhood on, and creating new and original forms and ways of living. If one does not do this, one is refusing to grow, refusing to avail himself of his possibilities; one is shirking his responsibility to himself. Hence refusal to actualize one’s possibilities brings guilt toward one’s self. But creating also means destroying the status quo of one’s environment, breaking the old forms; it means producing something new and original in human relations as well as in cultural forms (e.g., the creativity of the artist). Thus every experience of creativity has its potentiality of aggression or denial toward other persons in one’s environment or established patterns within one’s self. To put the matter figuratively, in every experience of creativity something in the past is killed that something new in the present may be born. Hence, for Kierkegaard, guilt feeling is always a concomitant of anxiety: both are aspects of experiencing and actualizing possibility. The more creative the person, he held, the more anxiety and guilt are potentially present.
author: Rollo May
tags: anxiety, creativity, mindset

quote: Thankfully, perseverance is a great substitute for talent.
author: Steve Martin, Born Standing Up: A Comic's Life
tags: celebrity, celebrity-memoir, creativity, creativity-and-attitude, memoir, perseverance, talent

quote: When I’ve lost my way or when I am confused about a path to take, I remember that most answers I need I already possess – deep inside. I am naturally creative, resourceful and whole. If I consult my invisible compass, I’ll know what to do.
author: Steve Goodier
tags: answers, creativity, found, guidance, inner-guidance, inner-voice, lost, resourcefulness, wholeness

quote: It is true that all men are created in the image of God, but Christians are supposed to be conscious of that fact, and being conscious of it should recognize the importance of living artistically, aesthetically, and creatively, as creative creatures of the Creator. If we have been created in the image of an Artist, then we should look for expressions of artistry, and be sensitive to beauty, responsive to what has been created for us” (p. 32).
author: Edith Schaeffer, The Hidden Art of Homemaking
tags: artistry, creativity, homemaking

quote: It's ever so important to believe in what you do, trust your ability to create and show yourself worthy. Never sell yourself short.
author: Simon Zingerman, We All Need Heroes: Stories of the Brave and Foolish
tags: business, creativity, feel-good, good-hearted, goodness, hero, heroes, inspiration, inspirational, marketing, simon-zingerman, success, we-all-need-heroes, zingerman

quote: Those who seize the day become seriously rich.
author: Richard Koch, The 80/20 Principle: The Secret to Achieving More with Less
tags: ambition, creativity, motivation, productivity

quote: to paraphrase science writer John D. Barrow … we know they are impossible and yet we can imagine them anyway. Our brains, it turns out, are not prisoners of the world we live in; we can fly free! We can, any time we like, create the impossible.
author: Robert Krulwich
tags: creativity, imagination, writers

quote: You get your confidence and intuition back by trusting yourself, by being militantly on your own side. You need to trust yourself, especially on a first draft, where amid the anxiety and self-doubt, there should be a real sense of your imagination and your memories walking and woolgathering, tramping the hills, romping all over the place. Trust them. Don't look at your feet to see if you are doing it right. Just dance.
author: Anne Lamott, Bird by Bird
tags: creativity, dance, writing

quote: If you just write the kinds of stories you think others will want to read, you'll be competing with cartoonists who are far more enthusiastic for that kind of comic than you are, and they'll kick your ass every time.
author: Scott McCloud, Making Comics: Storytelling Secrets of Comics, Manga and Graphic Novels
tags: comics, creativity, storytelling

quote: Building positive customer experiences will help create passionate customers who will spread your message on their behalf - almost like an evangelist.
author: Simon Zingerman, We All Need Heroes: Stories of the Brave and Foolish
tags: art, business, creativity, feel-good, good-hearted, goodness, hero, heroes, hope, inspiration, inspirational, life, marketing, philosophy, simon-zingerman, success, we-all-need-heroes, wisdom, zingerman

quote: As an observer of human nature, let's just face the facts: stupid stuff sells, and often the more stupid and silly it is, the better it sells.
author: Simon Zingerman, We All Need Heroes: Stories of the Brave and Foolish
tags: art, business, creativity, feel-good, good-hearted, goodness, hero, heroes, hope, inspiration, inspirational, life, marketing, philosophy, simon-zingerman, success, we-all-need-heroes, wisdom, zingerman

quote: I am sure that there is no place in the world where your message would not be enhanced by your making the place (whether tiny or large, a hut or a palace) orderly, artistic and beautiful with some form of creativity, some form of ‘art’ (p. 213).
author: Edith Schaeffer, The Hidden Art of Homemaking
tags: artistry, creativity, homemaking

quote: You know, all poetry may be a cry of generalised love, for this, or that, or the universe - which must be loved in its particularity, not its generality, but for its universal life in every minute particular. I have always supposed it to be a cry of ;unsatisfied love; - and so it may be indeed - for satisfaction may surfeit it and so it may die. I know many poets who write only when in an exalted state of mind which they compare to ;being in love;,when they do not simply state, that they are in love, that they seek love - for this fresh damsel - or that lively young woman - in order to find a fresh metaphor, or a new bright vision of things in themselves. And to tell you the truth, I have always believed I could diagnose this state of ;being in love; which they regard as ;most particular;, as inspired by item, one pair of black eyes or indifferent blue, ;item;, one graceful attitude of body or mind, ;item;, one female history of some twenty-two years from, shall we say 1821-1844 – I have always believed this ;in love; to be of something of the most abstract masking itself under the particular forms of both lover and beloved. And Poet who assumes and informs both.
author: A.S. Byatt, Possession
tags: creativity, inspiration, love, women

quote: No original thought still exists. People are original, each one of them. The same ideas that others had before you are waiting for you to bring them back to life in a new way. The part of who you are that is left behind within these old ideas is what makes them original all over again.
author: Ashly Lorenzana
tags: concepts, creativity, ideas, individuality, innovation, originality, people, thoughts, uniqueness

quote: In the religious myths, the creative will appears personified in God, and man already feels himself guilty when he assumes himself to be like God, that is, to ascribe this will to himself. In the heroic myths on the contrary, man appears as himself, creative and guilt for his suffering and fall is ascribed to God, that is, to his own will. Both are only extreme reaction phenomena of man wavering between his Godlikeness and his nothingness, whose will is awakened to the knowledge of its power and whose consciousness is aroused to terror before it.
author: Otto Rank, Truth and Reality
tags: creativity, existentialism

quote: Part of me would just like to relax and have one job that pays me the amount I need to survive. And another part of me wants the creativity that comes out of struggle and frustration and fear. It's a never-ending cycle, which must be how I want it, on some level.
author: Ahmir Questlove Thompson, Mo' Meta Blues: The World According to Questlove
tags: career, creativity, money, struggle

quote: What we at first deem useless might end up being the next bestseller. It can be the product's novelty, fun factor or sheer stupidity. Whatever the case, just remember there's always room on the market for an original business idea.
author: Simon Zingerman, We All Need Heroes: Stories of the Brave and Foolish
tags: art, business, creativity, feel-good, good-hearted, goodness, hero, heroes, hope, inspiration, inspirational, life, marketing, philosophy, simon-zingerman, success, we-all-need-heroes, wisdom, zingerman

quote: All art involves conscious discipline. If one is going to paint, do sculpture, design a building or write a book, it will involve discipline in time and energy — or there would never be any production at all to be seen, felt or enjoyed by ourselves or others. To develop ‘Hidden Art’ will also, of course, take time and energy – and the balance of the use of time is a constant individual problem for all of us: what to do, and what to leave undone. One is always having to neglect one thing in order to give precedence to something else. The question is one of priorities” (p. 32).
author: Edith Schaeffer, The Hidden Art of Homemaking
tags: creativity, homemaking

quote: The houses looked like something a child might draw, a row of shaky squares with triangles on top. Add a door, add two windows. Think of putting a tree in the front yard, and then decide against it because branches aren't worth the trouble.
author: David Sedaris, When You Are Engulfed in Flames
tags: artistic, creativity
