quote: Never fear having your ideas stolen. Your creative idea is a image you are painting like a picture on a canvas, they may "steal" your idea, however they cannot steal your paints.
author: Sumner Davenport
tags: attitude, bouncing-back, creativity

quote: I never drew a picture of anything that was before me but always from fancy, a sure sign of the absence of artistic eyesight; and I illustrated my lack of real feeling for art by a very early speech: 'Mama,' said I, 'I have drawed a man. Shall I draw his soul now?
author: Robert Louis Stevenson
tags: art, childhood, creativity

quote: We must not imitate that which we seek to create.
author: Georges Braque
tags: art, creativity, inspiration

quote: Using your talent, hobby or profession in a way that makes you cintribute with something good to this world is truly the way to go.
author: Simon Zingerman, We All Need Heroes: Stories of the Brave and Foolish
tags: art, business, creativity, feel-good, good-hearted, goodness, hero, heroes, hope, inspiration, inspirational, life, marketing, philosophy, simon-zingerman, success, we-all-need-heroes, wisdom, zingerman

quote: Art isn't life, you know. It if were, the world would go up in flames. It's artifice. By definition.("Talking In The Dark")
author: Dennis Etchison, Shadows 7
tags: art, creativity, falseness

quote: Why of course it's unlikely!' I said. 'Oh, by far!The awesome-est things in the world often are!
author: Al Yankovic, My New Teacher and Me!
tags: creativity, imagination, uniqueness

quote: Soak blanket in gravy and make a delicious brick wrap. Serve in All Gravy Room at the Mandrake Hotel.
author: Christoph Fischer
tags: blanket, brick, brick-and-blanket, brick-and-blanket-test, creative, creativity, delicious, funny, gravy, hospitality, hotel, humor, serve, service, yummy

quote: Creativity is on the side of health - it isn't the thing that drives us mad
author: it is the capacity in us that tries to save us from madness.
tags: Jeanette Winterson, Why Be Happy When You Could Be Normal?

quote: I sometimes wonder whether the act of surrender is not one of the greatest of all - the highest. It is one of the [most] difficult of all... You see it's so immensely complicated. It needs real humility and at the same time, an absolute belief in one's own essential freedom. It is an act of faith. At the last moments, like all great acts, it is pure risk. This is true for me as a human being and as a writer. Dear Heaven, how hard it is to let go - to step into the blue. And yet one's creative life depends on it and one desires to do nothing else.
author: Katherine Mansfield, Katherine Mansfield Letters And Journals: A Selection
tags: creativity, faith, freedom, humility, risk, surrender, writing

quote: Edward Gibbon, in his classic work on the fall of the Roman Empire, describes the Roman era's declension as a place where "bizarreness masqueraded as creativity.
author: Edward Gibbon, The Decline and Fall of the Roman Empire
tags: art, creativity, shock

quote: Hallo, Pooh,” said Rabbit.“Hallo, Rabbit,” said Pooh dreamily.“Did you make that song up?”“Well, I sort of made it up,” said Pooh. “It isn’t Brain,” he went on humbly, “because You Know Why, Rabbit; but it comes to me sometimes.”“Ah!” said Rabbit, who never let things come to him, but always went and fetched them.
author: A.A. Milne, The House at Pooh Corner
tags: creativity, inspiration, muse

quote: Creative work bridges time because the energy of art is not time-bound. If it were we should have no interest in the art of the past, except as history or documentary. But our interest in art is our interest in ourselves both now and always. Here and forever. There is a sense of the human spirit as always existing. This makes our death bearable. Life + art is a boisterous communion/communication with the dead. It is a boxing match with time.
author: Jeanette Winterson, Why Be Happy When You Could Be Normal?
tags: art, creativity, death, history, human-spirit, life, time

quote: Boredom is a lack of crazy. Its a lack of creativity. Invention. Innovation. If you're bored, blame yourself.
author: Katelyn S. Bolds
tags: crazy, creativity, inspirational, invention

quote: Even though artists of all kinds claim to put their hearts and souls into their works, it will only confuse you, for example, if you try to discern a painter by his paintings. His masterpiece may be the master because of its iridescence; it may display a hundred different perspectives through his single face.
author: Criss Jami, Diotima, Battery, Electric Personality
tags: art, artist, creativity, discernment, iridescence, masterpiece, painting, perspective

quote: This was the sort of ebullience and élan I prayed for when I felt the desire to write. I used to sit down and wait for this to happen. But it never did happen- not this way. It happened afterwards, sometimes when I had left the machine and gone for a walk. Yes, suddenly it would come on, like an attack, pell-mell, from every direction, a veritable inundation, an avalanche- and there I was, helpless, miles away from the typewriter, not a piece of paper in my pocket.
author: Henry Miller, Sexus
tags: creativity, henry-miller, sexus, truth, writing

quote: Work as if there's no one to help you, and learn as if everybody is with you.
author: saransh garg
tags: attitude-toward-life, creativity, hard-work, leadership, motivational-inspirational, oppurtunity, passion

quote: Spiritual growth and creativity are two sides of the same coin.
author: Lada Ray
tags: creativity, spiritual-growth, writing

quote: For years to come the debris of a convulsed world will beset our steps. It will require a purpose stronger than any man and worthy of all men to calm and inspirit us. A sane society whose riches are happy children, men and women, beautiful with peace and creative activity, is not going to be ordained for us. We must make it ourselves.
author: Helen Keller, The Open Door
tags: creativity, education, happiness, hope, inspiration, optimism, perfect-world

quote: Something went greatly wrong in our collective history and the starting point of it was the industrial revolution. Our school systems are focussed on a single objective: to produce model citizens for society in order to feed this machine and prevent its breakdown. That’s why our school systems have no interest in developing models that actually require and stimulate useful values in people, such as courage or imagination or inventiveness. None of these are taught in our schools, on the contrary the system focuses on memorizing. Memorizing is a way of overloading the mind with mental baggage it doesn’t really need. Besides being horribly dull and stiffening the effect of 20 years of abundant memorization training is modern man: an unimaginative creature stuffed with useless knowledge and unable to clean his mind of this information dirt: our school systems are purposely constructed to deliver mental automatons that are unable to think creatively.
author: Martijn Benders
tags: creativity, school-system

quote: I create, therefore I am.
author: Lada Ray
tags: creativity, writing

quote: On Pilgrim's Progress: “I could not have believed beforehand that Calvinism could be painted in such exquisitely delightful colors.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge
tags: creativity, evangelism, gospel

quote: God is the creator, so for that human creativity is a work of Divine.
author: Petra Remes
tags: aspiration, creativity, divine, god, inspiration

quote: Economics itself offers a parallel that explains why this integration affects creativity. Clay Christensen has written about the “Innovator’s Dilemma”: the fact that large traditional firms find it rational to ignore new, breakthrough technologies that compete with their core business. The same analysis could help explain why large, traditional media companies will undermine our tradition of free culture. The property right that is copyright is no longer the balanced right that it was, or was intended to be. The property right that is copyright has become unbalanced, tilted toward an extreme. The opportunity to create and transform becomes weakened in a world in which creation requires permission and creativity must check with a lawyer.
author: Lawrence Lessig, Free Culture: The Nature and Future of Creativity
tags: copyright, creativity, culture

quote: We're all innately creative
author: I'm not bringing anything magical to it. Ninety percent of inventing is putting in the hours and just trying. You don't need to make a big leap—you - need to take a thousand small steps.
tags: James Jorash

quote: Creativity is nothing but an intelligent imitation.
author: Sandeep Kakkar
tags: creativity

quote: Love the writing, love the writing, love the writing... the rest will follow.
author: Jane Yolen
tags: ambition, ambitions, creativity, love, writing

quote: You receive a great number of rewards as soon as you begin creating something you dream of deep within your soul.
author: Marc Allen, The Millionaire Course: A Visionary Plan for Creating the Life of Your Dreams
tags: creativity, entrepreneurship, purpose

quote: People who have a creative side and do not live it out are most disagreeable clients. They make a mountain out of a molehill, fuss about unnecessary things, are too passionately in love with somebody who is not worth so much attention, and so on. There is a kind of floating charge of energy in them which is not attached to its right object and therefore tends to apply exaggerated dynamism to the wrong situation.
author: Marie-Louise von Franz, Shadow and Evil in Fairy Tales
tags: artists, creativity, writers

quote: Ingenuity requires creativity.
author: Veronica Roth, Insurgent
tags: creativity, inspirational, wisdom

quote: For one thing is needful: that a human being should attain satisfaction with himself, whether it be by means of this or that poetry or art; only then is a human being at all tolerable to behold. Whoever is dissatisfied with himself is constantly ready for revenge, and we others will be his victims, if only by having to endure his ugly sight.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche
tags: calling, creativity, nietzsche, vocation

quote: It is better for the intellectual not to talk all the time. To begin with, it would exhaust him, and, above all, it would keep him from thinking. He must create if he can, first and foremost, especially if his creation does not side-step the problems of his time.
author: Albert Camus, Resistance, Rebellion and Death: Essays
tags: art, creativity, intellectual

quote: I’d stumbled upon the inner sanctuary of a woman who loved the world. Loved the faces of people she saw. Loved the way a hand looked when it was relaxed. Loved the way a woman looked when she touched her own face. The way a man looked when he opened himself to her. Loved the way wind changed a tree or a field or a child’s hair. The beauty of a neck meeting a shoulder. The softness of a smile that wasn’t forced.
author: Laura Anderson Kurk, Perfect Glass
tags: art, artist, college-application, creativity, dating, glass-girl, henry-whitmire, high-school, jo-russell, laura-anderson-kurk, love, meg-kavanagh, painting, perfect-glass, romance, teen-books, teen-fiction, volunteerism, ya, young-adult-fiction

quote: What we wish for, dream and imagine is the very framework and foundation of everything we create
author: Cynthia Sue Larson, Reality Shifts: When Consciousness Changes the Physical World
tags: creativity, dreams, imagination, inspiration, philosophy, wisdom

quote: Art was as much in the activity as in the results. Works of art were not just the finished product, but the thought, the action, the process that created them.
author: Jean M. Auel, The Mammoth Hunters
tags: art, artistry, creativity, process

quote: All our contemporaries...had some big ideology to live for. Everybody thought he had to either fight in Spain or die for something else, and most of us had to be in prison for one reason or another. And then at the end it turns out that none of these great ideologies was worth your sacrificing anything for. Even doing personal good is very difficult to be absolutely sure about. It's very difficult to know exactly whether to live for an ideology or even to live for doing good. But there cannot be anything wrong in making a pot, I'll tell you. When making a pot you can't bring any evil into the world. - Eva Zeisel, ceramist.
author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, Creativity: Flow and the Psychology of Discovery and Invention
tags: creativity, purpose

quote: Successful continual learning means maintaining a balance and variety of success-oriented attributes, the most prominent being awareness, confidence, persistence, determination, courage, and focus. But curiosity, ingenuity, and creativity may be even more important as it is these traits that fuel the desire to continue to question and challenge the status quo.
author: Lorii Myers, No Excuses, The Fit Mind-Fit Body Strategy Book
tags: awareness, confidence, courage, creativity, determination, focus-curiosity, ingenuity, learning, persistance, success, successful-living

quote: To make a real independent film where the filmmaker is in charge creatively, one must sacrifice personal, financial, and physical well-being.
author: Mark Polish, The Declaration of Independent Filmmaking: An Insider's Guide to Making Movies Outside of Hollywood
tags: creativity, film, filmmaking, independence

quote: Reality shifts occur when we are in a dreamy state of energized awareness in which we are clear about what we prefer
author: Cynthia Sue Larson, Reality Shifts: When Consciousness Changes the Physical World
tags: creativity, dreams, manifestation, philosophy, reality

quote: When you're making something, you're in a different state. You go into a deep level of concentration, to the point where you're not self-conscious anymore, it's just flowing out of you.
author: David Rakoff, Don't Get Too Comfortable: The Indignities of Coach Class, The Torments of Low Thread Count, The Never-Ending Quest for Artisanal Olive Oil, and Other First World Problems
tags: creativity

quote: Venture deep into the wilderness of lost thought to the point that you physically shiver with apprehension, and there you will find creativity
author: Carl Henegan
tags: apprehension, creativity, venture

quote: The most creative approach is often the simple approach.
author: Phil Cooke
tags: creativity, simplicity

quote: My first thought, as a child, was that the artist brings something into the world that didn't exist before, and that he does it without destroying something else. A kind of refutation of the conservation of matter. That still seems to me its central magic, its core of joy.
author: John Updike
tags: art, artist, creativity, writing

quote: My mom told me once that Wyatt loved her the way a boy will love his mother, but I loved her the way an artist loves another. Jo taught me what that meant.
author: Laura Anderson Kurk, Perfect Glass
tags: art, artist, creativity, dating, death, family, family-relationships, glass-girl, grief, henry-whitmire, jo-russell, laura-anderson-kurk, love, meg-kavanagh, mother-daughter-relationship, perfect-glass, romance, siblings, teen-fiction, teen-literature, ya, young-adult-fiction

quote: Art gives its vision to beauty not always recognized. And it surrenders freely -- whatever power it possesses to every sincere soul that seeks it. But above all else--it presents us with the gift of ourselves.
author: Aberjhani, Journey through the Power of the Rainbow: Quotations from a Life Made Out of Poetry
tags: altruism, art, artists, creative-vision, creativity, gifts, integrity, nanowrimo, national-novel-writing-month, sincerity

quote: Look at this one.” I picked up a small painting of a man with dark hair and a short, dark beard. He wore a loose shirt, cobalt blue, unbuttoned at the top, showing a prominent, knobby collarbone. He looked…complicated and hungry. She’d captured him focused intensely on a book, his face pressed against a wall like he was resting. Or waiting.
author: Laura Anderson Kurk, Perfect Glass
tags: art, artist, breakups, college, creativity, dating, glass-girl, henry-whitmire, high-school, laura-anderson-kurk, long-distance-relationship, love, meg-kavanagh, painter, painting, perfect-glass, relationship, romance, teen-fiction, volunteerism, ya, young-adult-fiction

quote: Those who loved with all their heart and mind and might have always thought of death, and those who knew the endless nights of harrowing concern for others have longed for it. The life I want is a life I could not endure in eternity. It is a life of love and intensity, suffering and creation, that makes life worthwhile and death welcome. There is no other life I should prefer. Neither should I like not to die." (The Faith of a Heretic)
author: Walter Kaufmann
tags: creation, creativity, death, eternity, love, walter-kaufmann

quote: To express open creativity, you first need to create your own space of seclusion.
author: Anthony Liccione
tags: creativity, expression, seclusion, space

quote: Something terrible happens to people who don't create, something poisonous. Creating is a necessity for all humans, like breathing. If you don't do it, you suffer.
author: K.A. Laity, Rook Chant: Collected Writings on Witchcraft and Paganism
tags: creation, creativity, human, inspiration

quote: Sometimes broken hearts are needed, that way you will appreciate the one that handles it with care.
author: Lilly Ghalichi
tags: creativity, inspirational, popular

quote: I worried I would miss it, and I knew, from losing Wyatt, that things happen the moment the soul is released. Wyatt had been there in the school, watching me, making sure I survived. Souls linger…they do. They linger a bit before they turn toward eternity. It could be that no matter how perfect their future will be, the past still tugs for a moment.
author: Laura Anderson Kurk, Perfect Glass
tags: art, artist, creativity, death, dying, glass-girl, grief, henry-whitmire, hospital, jo-russell, laura-anderson-kurk, meg-kavanagh, perfect-glass, soul, teen-fiction, teen-literature, what-happens-when-you-die, ya, young-adult-fiction

quote: Jo told me once that she was an old woman everywhere but in her studio. “There I’m only myself,” she’d said. Standing in the middle of masterpieces that only Jo had ever seen and touched, I knew what she meant.
author: Laura Anderson Kurk, Perfect Glass
tags: art, art-studio, artist, creativity, dating, glass-girl, jo-russell, laura-anderson-kurk, love, painting, perfect-glass, relationship, romance, teen-books, teen-fiction, ya, young-adult-fiction

quote: I am a creator, writing like the wind, I carry the weight of a future world in the barrel of a pen, etching my characters into the paper with life giving ink so my dreams and reality might finally meet.
author: L.M. Fields
tags: creativity, inspirational-quotes, writing-process

quote: God chose to introduce Himself to us in the first verse of Genesis as a Creator. And yet so few Christians really understand the power of creativity to influence the culture.
author: Phil Cooke
tags: creativity, sovereignty-of-god

quote: If we weren’t already doing it this way, is this the way we would start?
author: Paul Depodesta
tags: creativity, different, naive

quote: Great art comes from passion, from a need to expose human spirit in the face of mortality, the small cruelties and heroisms that make up daily life -- that's where great work comes from, and if you enable students in this way to discover those impulses and observations in themselves, those heroisms and cruelties in themselves, you create an atmosphere in which art can emerge.
author: Deb Margolis
tags: art, creativity, passion

quote: I can certainly throw out some observation about the process of creating which may be of use. Firstly, it's the best & the worst of worlds, because the only fuel you have to make the fire blaze on the page / screen is the stuff of your own being. An artist consumes his or herself in the act of making art. I can feel that consumption even now, sitting here at my desk at the end of a working day. In order to generate the ideas that I have set on the page for the last 10 or 11 hours I have burned the fuel of my own history. This is, obviously a double-edged sword. In order to give, the artist must take from himself. That's the deal. And it's very important to me that the work I do is the best I can make it, because I know what is being burned up to create. As the villain of Sacrament says: "living & dying, we feed the fire.
author: Clive Barker
tags: artist-s-life, creativity, writing

quote: Rule of thumb: The more important a call or action is to our soul's evolution, the Resistance we will feel toward pursuing it.
author: Steven Pressfield, The War of Art: Break Through the Blocks & Win Your Inner Creative Battles
tags: art, creativity, inspirational, writing

quote: The professional learns to recognize envy-driven criticism and to take it for what it is: the supreme compliment. The critic hates most that which he would have done himself if he had had the guts.
author: Steven Pressfield, The War of Art: Break Through the Blocks & Win Your Inner Creative Battles
tags: art, creativity, envy, writing

quote: I'd say I never considered myself a great architect. I'm more of a creative problem solver with good taste and a soft spot for logistical nightmares.
author: Maria Semple, Where'd You Go, Bernadette
tags: creativity

quote: I could write about how I feel when I sing, write and create something from heartbreak, sorrow, sadness or just simply nothingness. How nothingness can become the most beautiful, unexplainable feeling that makes you forget about gravity for an hour.
author: Charlotte Eriksson, Empty Roads & Broken Bottles; in search for The Great Perhaps
tags: art, beautiful-chaos, creative-process, creativity, heartbreak, inspiration, music, poetry, singing, writing, writing-inspiration

quote: Creativity involves breaking out of established patterns in order to look at things in a different way.
author: Terry Tempest Williams, When Women Were Birds: Fifty-four Variations on Voice
tags: breaking-out, breaking-patterns, creative, creativity, patterns, thinking-differently

quote: Where the Divine and the Human Meet" shows how important it is to meet the world with the creativity of an artist, particularly in these uncertain times: "What do we do with chaos? Creativity has an answer. We are told by those who have studied the processes of nature that creativity happens at the border between chaos and order. Chaos is a prelude to creativity. We need to learn, as every artist needs to learn, to live with chaos and indeed to dance with it as we listen to it and attempt some ordering. Artists wrestle with chaos, take it apart, deconstruct and reconstruct from it. Accept the challenge to convert chaos into some kind of order, respecting the timing of it all, not pushing beyond what is possible—combining holy patience with holy impatience--that is the role of the artist. It is each of our roles as we launch the twenty-first century because we are all called to be artists in our own way. We were all artists as children. We need to study the chaos around us in order to turn it into something beautiful. Something sustainable. Something that remains".
author: Matthew Fox, Creativity
tags: artist, artists-life, chaos, creativity, divine, divine-love

quote: We are not consumers. For most of humanity’s existence, we were makers, not consumers: we made our clothes, shelter, and education, we hunted and gathered our food.We are not addicts. “I propose that most addictions come from our surrendering our real powers, that is, our powers of creativity.” We are not passive couch potatoes either. “It is not the essence of humans to be passive. We are players. We are actors on many stages…. We are curious, we are yearning to wonder, we are longing to be amazed… to be excited, to be enthusiastic, to be expressive. In short to be alive.” We are also not cogs in a machine. To be so would be to give up our personal freedoms so as to not upset The Machine, whatever that machine is. Creativity keeps us creating the life we wish to live and advancing humanity’s purpose as well.
author: Matthew Fox, Creativity
tags: addiction, addictions, consumer-culture, consumerism, creation, creativity, humanity

quote: I believe in always being open to learning more through exploration of everything available and following one's sense of curiosity, creativity, and playfulness.
author: Jay Woodman
tags: creativity, curiosity, exploration, learn, learning, open, playfulness

quote: Flexibility is a requirement for survival.
author: Roger Von Oech, A Whack on the Side of the Head: How You Can Be More Creative
tags: creativity, flexibility, happiness, life, survival, thinking

quote: To create today is to create dangerously. Any publication is an act, and that act exposes one to the passions of an age that forgives nothing.
author: Albert Camus, Resistance, Rebellion and Death: Essays
tags: art, creativity, publication

quote: The creative impulse can be killed, but it cannot be taught...What a teacher can do...in working with children, is to give the flame enough oxygen so that it can burn. As far as I'm concerned, this providing of oxygen is one of the noblest of all vocations.
author: Madeleine L'Engle, A Circle of Quiet
tags: art, creativity, teaching, vocation

quote: It's difficult to get your creative juices flowing if you're always being practical, following rules, afraid to make mistakes, not looking into outside areas, or under the influence of any of the other mental locks.
author: Roger Von Oech, A Whack on the Side of the Head: How You Can Be More Creative
tags: afraid, creativity, ideas, influence, locks, mental, mistakes, rules, think

quote: Tomorrow is no hazardous affair, a day like any other day: tomorrow is the result of many yesterdays and comes with a potent, cumulative effect. I am tomorrow what I chose to be yesterday and the day before. It is not possible that tomorrow I may negate and nullify everything that led me to this present moment.
author: Henry Miller, The Cosmological Eye
tags: creativity, inspirational, writing

quote: There is nothing higher-class than real craftsmanship, diversity, originality and the service of skilled human hands.
author: Bryant McGill
tags: brilliance, craftmanship, creativity, originality, resourcefulness

quote: I hear he liked flowers pretty well.""Yes," said Annie, "he said they were the friends who always came back and never disappointed him."--"Out, Brief Candle
author: Kurt Vonnegut Jr., While Mortals Sleep: Unpublished Short Fiction
tags: creativity, disappointment, flowers, friends, nature

quote: Creation's probably overrated. After all, God made the world in only six days and rested on the seventh.
author: Ernest Hemingway, A Moveable Feast
tags: creation, creativity, god, overrated, seventh

quote: You and I are stymied in our own creativity. We can only create as sub-creators, and even then our best work is only sub-creation.
author: Matt      Chandler, The Explicit Gospel
tags: creativity

quote: Creativity and passion dwindle when hungry. Premiums for talent are easier to demand when desperation isn’t part of the equation. If I’m established, I can demand $350 an hour. If I’m desperate, I may accept $5.
author: John-Talmage Mathis, For the (Soon) Unemployed: You Against Them
tags: creativity, entrepreneurship, money, passion

quote: P.S. It's not schizophrenia, it's creativity, there is a difference. My voices go away after I let them tell their stories.
author: Ashley Newell
tags: creativity, writing

quote: Creativity is the greatest expression of liberty.
author: Bryant McGill, Voice of Reason
tags: creativity, liberty

quote: Fierce praying was a way of finding entrance and prologue into my own writing.
author: Pat Conroy, My Losing Season: A Memoir
tags: creativity, prayer

quote: where does creativity come from?  Creativity comes from the Universe itself. “There is music and poetry in the Universe itself — surely we hear it on planet earth.” And Creativity comes from our joys and sorrows, our deep-hearted experiences. It also comes “from and in the heart of God. All our spiritual traditions the world over agree that creativity follows through the human heart and that it flows from the Divine Heart.”Creativity is seen as a spiritual, inwardly-driven activity, directly influenced by a Higher Power, or God. That is the ultimate in inspiration for me: to know I have “permission” to be creative and to be a creator too.
author: Matthew Fox, Creativity
tags: birth, creativity, inspirational, life, music, poetry, spiritual-development, spirituality, universe

quote: Life is a cracked surface at best. Fiction is a nice edifice. / every word/sentence/paragraph gives a writer an opportunity to reinforce or deliberately crack the edifice by screwing with meaning, structure, grammar, the fourth wall, etc. / different types and degrees of cracking produce different arrangements of order and chaos.
author: K.J. Bishop
tags: chaos, creativity, inspirational, writing

quote: What does one do with experience? Do we react negatively, or do we (pro)create from the space of positivity?
author: T.F. Hodge, From Within I Rise: Spiritual Triumph Over Death and Conscious Encounters with "The Divine Presence"
tags: conditions, creativity, experience, life, quotes-to-live-by, reaction, space

quote: What if your art could provide everything you ever needed or wanted in life?
author: Patti Digh, Creative Is a Verb: If You're Alive, You're Creative
tags: art, artists-life, creativity, question-do-what-you-love

quote: If you're alive, you're creative.
author: Patti Digh, Creative Is a Verb: If You're Alive, You're Creative
tags: creative-expression, creativity, encouragement-and-attitude

quote: The audacity of my sagacity is instrumentality to my successity.
author: Ifeanyi Enoch Onuoha
tags: america, audacity, creativity, ifeanyi-enoch-onuoha, inspiration, instrumentality, leader, nigeria, sagacity, success, successity, wordsmith, youth

quote: Sometimes time spent reinventing the wheel results in a revolutionary new rolling device. But sometimes it just amounts to time spent reinventing the wheel.
author: Steve Krug, Don't Make Me Think: A Common Sense Approach to Web Usability
tags: creativity, design, invention, work

quote: We make a home for ourselves, every time we work on something: actors, writers, singers, building these little nests in our gypsy souls, in place of the ones we so seldom seem to make in our own lives. And then suddenly it's over, and we have to start again.
author: Alan Brennert
tags: creativity, imagination, writers, writing

quote: The creative mind plays with the object it loves.
author: C.G. Jung
tags: creativity

quote: You know how creative people are, we have to try everything until we find our niche.
author: E.A. Bucchianeri, Brushstrokes of a Gadfly
tags: art, artists, artists-life, arts-and-humanities, creative-people, creative-process, creative-work, creativity, experimenting, finding-your-niche, finding-yourself, niche, trying-new-things

quote: Becoming aware of our inner man and woman means to discover the roots and creative potential of both the male and female aspect within ourselves. Becoming aware of the inner man and woman means to understand that they have different visions of life. It means to understand that they have different perspectives and views of life. The inner man and woman are our two wings of love and freedom. Through awareness, acceptance and understanding, we can allow our two wings to develop in a deep and natural harmony. In the world today, a one-sided development of the male side leads to destructivity. A one-sided development of the male side leads to ego, struggle, exhaustion and a separation from life. A one-sided development of the female side leads to passivity and dependence.
author: Swami Dhyan Giten, Presence - Working from Within. The Psychology of Being
tags: acceptance, awareness, creativity, dependence, destructivity, ego, exhaustion, freedom, inner-man-and-woman, life, love, meditation, passivity, relationships, separation, struggle, understanding

quote: Creativity finds its own creator.
author: Girish Kohli
tags: creativity

quote: A Seed for Contemplation:Creative people who cherish the gift of life often slip into the secret chambers of the creative mind. Their solutions are well-rounded, more sensible than those of people who rely solely upon reason as their mainstay. Gratitude unseals fountains of creativity, because a grateful person is relaxed. This allows him to take stock of his circumstances with an objective mind. A creative person often gets three-dimensional answers to his problems. — ,
author: Harold Klemp, The Language of Soul: Keys to Living a More Meaningful Life
tags: creativity, inspirational, soul

quote: Many a person over the years has tried- both successfully and unsuccessfully, to get rid of their inner demons. Those who are successful are deemed artists, those who are not are call dreamers at best and lunatics at worse. But where exactly resides that line on which two worlds collide? Does somebody know? Is somebody fit to tell? Who's to say that those deemed lunatics are not just successes on the making? Who says that those who claim to be just a tad bit crazy are not just as crazy as those that had completely lost it? Maybe, and bear with me here…everyone is as crazy as the one before them and the next one could ever possibly be. Maybe at the end- it's just that some have mastered creating a façade of calmness and collection while others don't bother going through all that trouble anymore, if they ever did. Perhaps we all have demons…it's just that some people have demons far more toxic and difficult to ignore than others.
author: Eiry Nieves
tags: craziness, creativity, inner-demons, logic, success

quote: The noise around us determines how we speak. And how we listen. Just as a conversation suffers in a war zone, art suffers in a culture built on noise. So does our enjoyment of it.
author: Michael Gungor, The Crowd, the Critic, and the Muse: A Book for Creators
tags: artists, creativity, musicians, worship

quote: And so I miss the fertilization that might come from a contact. And for me--yes, I think I might as well admit it--fertilization does come a great deal from contacts. Why then do I avoid them--in a sort of false pride--shyness--timorous modesty? I used to be afraid of falling in love with people--or having them think I was--that I was chasing them (how ridiculous--I am actually always running away!) but now surely--I should be mature enough to be over that. I am no longer afraid of falling in love, and the other false modesties should vanish. I cannot bear to think "par delicatesse j'ai perdu ma vie." (Because of discretion I have lost my life).
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh, Against Wind and Tide: Letters and Journals, 1947-1986
tags: creativity, journal, rest, work

quote: The twin aspects of genius, the passive and the active, are possessed by the fully realized artist; they also form the necessary equipment of the Adept. Yet in very few people are these twin aspects manifested. Nearly everyone has a capacity for the passive aspect, which involves some sort of appreciation of aesthetic values. There are few people totally unresponsive to the beauties of nature, and none at all that is not responsive to its ferocious manifestations.Fewer are able to respond profoundly to the beauty of natural phenomena, and fewer still to so-called works of art. It takes a degree of genius to respond to such manifestations the whole time. Artists in this category are among the saints, some of whom thrilled with rapture at the constant awareness of the total unity, harmony, and beauty of things.Such were Boehme, Ramakrishna, etc. Some yogis are immersed in an unsullied and vibrant bliss derived from the incessant contemplation of this 'world-bewitching maya'4-the breath-taking wonder of the great and glamorous illusion which surrounds us.On the other side of the fence, on the side of active or creative genius, there are yet fewer. Active or creative genius means nothing less than the ability to translate the wonder or the terror of the great lfla (the great play of life) in terms of visual, tactile, audible, olfactory, or some other sensual presentation of phenomena.But there is a third aspect of genius which is yet more rare. It is the ability to open the door of the theatre and admit the influences from outside, from the swarming gulfs beyond the grasp of the mind, and accessible only to the magical entity whose fantastic feelers can snare the most fugitive impulses as they flash through the holes in space, the kinks in time, to be reflected in the magic mirror of the artist's mind.
author: Kenneth Grant, Outside the Circles Of Time
tags: creativity, genius, magick

quote: Science, in all its greatness, is still subject to human creativity. It starts the first moment a child tries to reach up and grab at the clouds. Soon, the child learns that his own hands cannot reach the sky, but his hands are not the limit of his potential. For the human brain observes, considers, understands, and adapts. Locked within the mind is infinite possibility.
author: Yukito Kishiro, Aqua Knight, Vol. 3
tags: cognition, creativity, humanity, inspirational, science

quote: Try your ideas. You might surprise yourself.
author: Jason O'Neill, Bitten by the Business Bug: Common Sense Tips for Business and Life from a Teen Entrepreneur
tags: creativity, entrepreneurs, inspirational

quote: When you view your world exclusively through the lens of science, your prescription will never be strong enough.
author: Jay  Nichols
tags: art, awe, creativity, left-brain, mysticism, quantum-physics, reality, science, spirtuality, wonder

quote: A great writer picks up on those things that matter. It’s almost like their radar is attuned to the most significant moments.
author: Alain de Botton
tags: creativity, importance, literature, writer, writers-on-writing

quote: Trying to teach creativity is the major hoax of our time along with the Iraq war and plastic surgery" ~ Snarky comment of Clive from "The River Swimmer" (pg 47)
author: Jim Harrison
tags: creativity

quote: In other words, if Dostoyevsky and Tolstoy showed more than their fair share of pathology it was due less to the requirements of their creative work than to the personal sufferings caused by the unhealthy conditions of a Russian society nearing collapse. If so many American poets and playwrights committed suicide or ended up addicted to drugs and alcohol it was not their creativity that did it but an artistic scene that promised much, gave few rewards and left nine out of ten artists neglected if not ignored.
author: Mihaly Csikszentmihalyi, Creativity: Flow and the Psychology of Discovery and Invention
tags: creativity, writing

quote: Poetry lets me pour out my various emotions even the suppressed ones we didn't know exist inside us' til the moment you start jotting down what you're feeling. It's more than an escape into the unknown, a refuge for your creativity and sometimes wild imagination not all ordinary, ungifted people like us understand." -Elizabeth's Quotes
author: Elizabeth E. Castillo
tags: creativity, elizabeth-e-castillo, poet, poetry

quote: Often we are identified with either the inner man or woman, while the other side is hidden and unexpressed. Outer relationships are a mirror of the relationship and communication between our own inner man and female side. Sometimes one side is dominant, while the other side is submissive.
author: Swami Dhyan Giten, The Silent Whisperings of the Heart - An Introduction to Giten's Approach to Life
tags: awareness, communication, creativity, female, growth, inner-man-and-woman, male, relationships, spirituality

quote: It is when we develop both our inner man and woman that we find a new harmony and wholeness within ourselves. Healing means to develop and integrate our inner man and woman so that love can flow between them. To rediscover our own inner source of love, we need to embrace both the male and female sides within ourselves. When these two sides are developed and integrated, a new spark of love, joy, harmony, creativity and wholeness arises within us. Awareness is an inner harmony between opposite poles and tendencies.
author: Swami Dhyan Giten, The Silent Whisperings of the Heart - An Introduction to Giten's Approach to Life
tags: creativity, harmony, healing, joy, love, wholeness

quote: A writer's mind can never be empty.
author: Michael Acciarino
tags: creativity, imagination

quote: Love means to understand the drama that happens between the inner man and woman. It means to allow both the inner man and woman to find their creative roots and expression.
author: Swami Dhyan Giten, The Silent Whisperings of the Heart - An Introduction to Giten's Approach to Life
tags: creativity, inner-man-and-woman, joy, love, relationships

quote: Traditionally men have created a deep split between the inner and outer world, between body and soul, between the material and spiritual world, between love and money and between male and female qualities. The inner man and woman are related to money, creativity and financial abundance. Through investigating the roots of the inner man and woman, we can find the creative potential of both the inner man and woman. Sometimes can either the inner man or woman also provide financial support for both sides, while the other side has the idea that it cannot support itself financially.
author: Swami Dhyan Giten, The Silent Whisperings of the Heart - An Introduction to Giten's Approach to Life
tags: body, creativity, financially, inner-man-and-woman, love, material-world, money, relationships, soul, spiritual-workd

quote: Through becoming aware of how the inner man and woman relates and communicates inside ourselves, it creates a joy and satisfaction in the three life areas that they influence: our meditation and inner growth, our relationships and our work and creativity.
author: Swami Dhyan Giten, The Silent Whisperings of the Heart - An Introduction to Giten's Approach to Life
tags: awareness, creativity, inner-growth, inner-man-and-woman, joy, meditation, relationships, satisfaction

quote: If the rock band U2 had been born in Orange County, California, would they have become just another church worship band?
author: Steve Turner
tags: adversity, creativity, passion, testimony, uniqueness

quote: If the spirit of wonder & curiosity stays alive in us, then surely we will always have new questions, and always expand our creativity in response?
author: Jay Woodman
tags: creativity, curiosity, questions, wonder

quote: You know how you're always trying to get things to come out perfect in art because it's real difficult in life
author: Woody Allen, Annie Hall: Screenplay
tags: creativity, perfection, reality

quote: People who know how to creatively break the rules also know why the rules were there in the first place.
author: Richard Rohr, Falling Upward: A Spirituality for the Two Halves of Life
tags: creativity, rules, second-half-of-life

quote: We can't underestimate the value of silence. We need to create ourselves, need to spend time alone. If you don't, you risk not knowing yourself and not realizing your dreams.
author: Jewel
tags: creativity, introverts, loneliness, silence

quote: Creativity occurs in the moment, and in the moment we are timeless.
author: Julia Cameron, The Artist's Way
tags: creativity, timelessness

quote: This is the extraordinary thing about creativity: If just you keep your mind resting against the subject in a friendly but persistent way, sooner or later you will get a reward from your unconscious.
author: John Cleese
tags: creativity, inspiration

quote: Poetry looking in the mirror sees art, and art looking in a mirror sings poetry.
author: Aberjhani, Illuminated Corners: Collected Essays and Articles Volume I.
tags: art, art-and-the-soul, creative-genius, creativity, famous-quotes-by-famous-poets, mirrors, national-poetry-month, poem-in-your-pocket-day, poetry-and-the-soul, quotes-on-art, quotes-on-poetry, world-poetry-day

quote: Art matters. It is not simply a leisure activity for the privileged or a hobby for the eccentric. It is a practical good for the world. The work of the artist is an expression of hope - it is homage to the value of human life, and it is vital to society. Art is a sacred expression of human creativity that shares the same ontological ground as all human work. Art, along with all work is the ordering of creation toward the intention of the creator.
author: Michael Gungor, The Crowd, The Critic And The Muse: A Book For Creators
tags: art, creativity

quote: Sometimes paper is only paper," my mothers says. "Words are just words. Ways to capture the real thing. Don't be afraid to remember that."I know what she means. Writing, painting, singing--it cannot stop everything. Cannot halt death in its tracks. But perhaps it can make the pause between death's footsteps sound and look and feel beautiful, can make the space of waiting a place where you can linger without as much fear. For we are all walking each other to our deaths, and the journey there between footsteps makes up our lives.
author: Ally Condie, Reached
tags: art, creation, creativity, words, words-have-power

quote: Some build their castles 'mid thunderbolts and fireworks. My worlds take shape in silence.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
tags: authors, castles, creativity, richelle, richelle-goodrich, worlds, writing

quote: Flow is something the reader experiences, not the writer.
author: Verlyn Klinkenborg
tags: creativity, editing, reading, writers, writing

quote: The heart of creativity is an experience of the mystical union
author: the heart of the mystical union is an experience of creativity.
tags: Julia Cameron, The Artist's Way

quote: To teach that a comparatively few men are responsible for the greatest forward steps of mankind is the worst sort of nonsense.
author: Henry Ford
tags: creativity, history, innovation

quote: The creative strength is good enough and deep enough to bring itself to flower and to grow in spite of this sickness.
author: Joanne Greenberg, I Never Promised You a Rose Garden
tags: art, artist, creativity, hope, inspiration

quote: Reality is only for people with no imagination.
author: Gavin Freeman
tags: creativity, imagine, reality

quote: Artistry exists in everyone. What makes it blossom is a soul's personal desire to find an outlet for expression.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
tags: artistry, author, creativity, expression, personal-expression, richelle, richelle-goodrich, writing

quote: Ideally a painter (and, generally, an artist) should not become conscious of his insights: without taking the detour through his conscious reflection, his progressive steps, mysterious even to himself, should enter so swiftly into the work that he is unable to recognize them in the moment of transition.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke, Letters on Cézanne
tags: aesthetics, art, creation, creativity, perception, self-knowledge, viewing

quote: we are continuing God’s work of forming, filling, and subduing. Whenever we bring order out of chaos, whenever we draw out creative potential, whenever we elaborate and “unfold” creation beyond where it was when we found it, we are following God’s pattern of creative cultural development.
author: Timothy J. Keller, Every Good Endeavor: Connecting Your Work to God's Plan for the World
tags: creativity, dominion, redemption, work

quote: Artists shouldn't wait until they are told what their art should be, they shouldn't follow trends or allow other people to influence their work, an artist should only create from the strongest emotions within their heart
author: Andrew James Pritchard
tags: being-a-writer, creativity, emotions, freedom-of-expression, trends, writing

quote: He said, one has to learn that painting well - in the academic and technical sense - comes right at the bottom of the list. I mean, you've got that ability. So have thousands.
author: John Fowles, The Collector
tags: art, artists, creativity, painting, skill

quote: This kind of passionate faith can be painful. Not caring is easy. Caring hurts. Caring costs you something. But without this sort of faith, you will never create to your fullest potential. Faith is a gift. Like I've said, felt belief is not necessarily something that you choose to have or not to have. But it is a gift that you can open yourself to receive.
author: Michael Gungor, The Crowd, The Critic And The Muse: A Book For Creators
tags: art, creativity, faith

quote: as an artist, one of the toughest things to do is getting someone to understand why you think the way you think. And as much as i don't wanna care what they think about my thinking, it comes down to making them understand or watching them leave.
author: Darnell Lamont Walker
tags: artists, creativity, life, understanding

quote: Strategy was first used in Athens (508 BC) to describe the art of leadership used by the ten generals on the war council. Some argue for the more creative, human side, while others argue for the more analytic side of strategy.
author: Max McKeown, The Strategy Book
tags: analysis, creativity, leadership, strategic, strategy

quote: ...if you always move in certainty, your writing will be flat - creativity is a rugged terrain...
author: John Geddes, A Familiar Rain
tags: creativity, writers, writing, writing-process

quote: Schools kill time and creativity. Find ways to workaround these limitations
author: Gossy Ukanwoke
tags: africa, creativity, education, learning, school

quote: When people sleep, others stay awake to effect changes in the world. Every other person wakes up in the morning to a totally different world
author: Gossy Ukanwoke
tags: change, creativity, inspirational

quote: A true great artist at heart never ceases to create, continuously amazes and keeps sharing his gift despite barriers, judgement, fears and dreaded myths. If you stopped being creative out of fear or loss of self-esteem or pride, you were never an artist first and foremost for you have ran away from your true calling." - Elizabeth's Quotes
author: Elizabeth E. Castillo, Seasons of Emotions
tags: artist, creativity, elizabeth-e-castillo

quote: Many gardeners will agree that hand-weeding is not the terrible drudgery that it is often made out to be. Some people find in it a kind of soothing monotony. It leaves their minds free to develop the plot for their next novel or to perfect the brilliant repartee with which they should have encountered a relative's latest example of unreasonableness.
author: Christopher  Lloyd, The Well-Tempered Garden
tags: creativity, gardening, inspiration

quote: The truth is that solitude is the creative condition of genius, religious or secular, and the ultimate sterilising of it. No human soul can long ignore "the giant agony of the world" and live, except indeed the mollusc life, a barnacle upon eternity.
author: Helen Waddell, The Desert Fathers
tags: creativity, genius, solitude, soul

quote: Mood evidently affects the operation of System 1: when we are uncomfortable and unhappy, we lose touch with our intuition.	These findings add to the growing evidence that good mood, intuition, creativity, gullibility, and increased reliance on System 1 form a cluster. At the other pole, sadness, vigilance, suspicion, an analytic approach, and increased effort also go together. A happy mood loosens the control of System 2 over performance: when in a good mood, people become more intuitive and more creative but also less vigilant and more prone to logical errors.
author: Daniel Kahneman, Thinking, Fast and Slow
tags: creativity, gullibility, mood, rationality

quote: To live a creative life we must first lose the fear of being wrong.
author: Joseph Chilton Pearce
tags: being-wrong, creativity, fear-of-failure

quote: The idea that the creative endeavor and mind-altering substances are entwined is one of the great pop-intellectual myths of our time. ... Substance abusing writers are just substance abusers — common garden variety drunks and druggies, in other words. Any claims that the drugs and alcohol are necessary to dull a finer sensibility are just the usual self-serving bullshit. I've heard alcoholic snowplow drivers make the same claim, that they drink to still the demons.
author: Stephen King, On Writing: A Memoir of the Craft
tags: creativity, substance-abuse, writing

quote: In the case of the creative mind, it seems to me, the intellect has withdrawn its watchers from the gates, and the ideas rush in pell-mell, and only then does it review and inspect the multitude. You worthy critics, or whatever you may call yourselves, are ashamed or afraid of the momentary and passing madness which is found in all real creators, the longer or shorter duration of which distinguishes the thinking artist from the dreamer. Hence your complaints of unfruitfulness, for you reject too soon and discriminate too severely.
author: Friedrich Schiller
tags: as-quoted-by-freud, creativity

quote: The more we become able to become a child again, to keep ourselves childlike, the more we can understand that because we love the world and we are open to understanding, to comprehension, that when we kill the child in us, we are no longer.
author: Paulo Freire, We Make the Road by Walking: Conversations on Education and Social Change
tags: childhood, comprehension, creativity, education, understanding, youth

quote: A scientist, an artist, a citizen is not like a child who needs papa methodology and mama rationality to give him security and direction; he can take care of himself, for he is the inventor not only of laws, theories, pictures, plays, forms of music, ways of dealing with his fellow man, institutions but also of entire world views, he is the inventor of entire forms of life.
author: Paul Karl Feyerabend, Science in a Free Society
tags: creativity, freedom, science

quote: Curiosity is very important I think, and I think too much of education, starting with childhood education, is either designed to kill curiosity or it works out that way anyway.
author: Myles Horton, We Make the Road by Walking: Conversations on Education and Social Change
tags: conformity, creativity, curiosity, education

quote: When I think of normality I think of mediocrity
author: Gillian Anderson
tags: creativity, life

quote: We create things to watch them grow, Ruin, she said. To take pleasure in seeing that which we love become more than it was before.
author: Brandon Sanderson, The Hero of Ages
tags: creativity, love

quote: ...the imagination is unleashed by constraints. You break out of the box by stepping into shackles.
author: Jonah Lehrer, Imagine: How Creativity Works
tags: constraints, creativity, imagination, limitations

quote: One is either an artist or one is not. It is not something one becomes. It is something that one is from birth. We do not study to be artists. We study to become more proficient. To understand more.
author: Edward Swift
tags: art, artistry, being-yourself, creativity, identity, self-knowledge

quote: The reflection of chaos is creativity.
author: Lionel Suggs
tags: chaos, creativity

quote: I once saw a small child go to an electric light switch as say, "Mamma, can I open the light?" She was using the age-old language of exploration, the language of art. It was a sort of metaphor, but she was not using it as ornamentation.
author: Ezra Pound
tags: creativity, language, poetry

quote: It is not many things that modern psychology agress upon, but all the different approaches of psychology agrees on one thing: that people in groups become more stupid. Individually people are more intelligent, because they have to take their own responsibility, but in a group they do not have to take the same responsibility. The two basic power strategies to try to manipulate and gain control over another person are: silencing and attacking. Silencing means to not listen to, to exclude or ignore and not respect a person. Attack can both mean to attack a person directly or to try to discredit a person through lies, to ridicule a person or by spreading malicious rumours. All organizations are more or less dysfunctional. In a dysfunctional group, the members of the group play three different roles: agressor, denier and victim. The agressor is the role that attack and ridicule people, the denier never knows what is going on, there is “no body at home”, and the victim is the resultat of these two roles. It is always easier to follow a group without awareness, than to follow your own heart, to trust your own intelligence, love, truth, silence and creativity.
author: Swami Dhyan Giten, Presence - Working from Within. The Psychology of Being
tags: aggressor, awareness, creativity, denier, dysfunctional-organizations, ego, groups-of-people, heart, intelligence, love, organizations, power, responsibility, silence, spirituality, truth, victim

quote: History tells creativity is a result of Soul song.
author: Aporva Kala, Life... Love... Kumbh...
tags: creativity

quote: One should not confuse creativity with whining.
author: Silvia Hartmann
tags: angsty, art, creativity, whining

quote: If it’s a pure expression of yourself no matter what it is or what medium, it’s going to shine. It’s going to resonate. You could look inside of yourself and you could have a canvas and you could paint a dot in it, but if that is where your creative purpose is taking you then it needs to be that dot.
author: Rainn Wilson
tags: art, creativity, expression

quote: The Indians say to draw someone's portrait is to steal their soul, i am taking photographs, does it mean that i am just borrowing them?
author: T.A
tags: creativity, photography

quote: No matter how hard they try, they'll never create anything so perfectly beautiful as what plays out in my own imagination.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich, Smile Anyway
tags: art, creativity, imagination, richelle, richelle-goodrich, wonder

quote: The basket would never make her famous or end up in a museum. The best part of it was the making of it, sitting at the table weaving while outside the lake crashed into shore and the seagulls roosted somewhere for the night and two women stopped for a moment to watch.
author: Ellen Airgood, South of Superior
tags: art, creativity, inspiration

quote: Authors always carry a means for scribbling and an excuse for pausing, often inopportunely, to record those fleeting sparks of creative fancy that might otherwise vanish like a wisp in the wind if ignored.  Writing is a jealous and needy lover.
author: Richelle E. Goodrich
tags: authors, creativity, inopportunity, jealousy, need, richelle, richelle-goodrich, writing

quote: But it’s still a big fight to get the work you’re really excited about onto shelves. And past that, convincing someone to pay you to do the work that you are most excited about is more than a trick, it’s a fucking scam of a magic trick.
author: Brandon S. Graham
tags: audiences, creativity, writing

quote: Consider the blundering anarchic system of the United States the stupidity of some of its lawmakers, the violent reaction, the slowness of its ability to change. Twenty-five key men destroyed could make the Soviet Union stagger, but we could lose our congress, our president, and our general staff and nothing much would have happened. We would go right on. In fact we might be better for it.
author: John Steinbeck, The Log from the Sea of Cortez
tags: creativity, freedom, individuality, us-politics

quote: Oh, man. I’m not interested to driving the Lamborghini. I’m more interested in making Lamborghini. That’s what creativity means to me.
author: Seong pill kon
tags: ara, creativity, me

quote: The necessary unlikeness between the creator and the created holds within it the equally necessary likeness of the thing made to him who makes it, and so of the work of the made to the work of the maker... The imagination of man is made in the image of the imagination of God.
author: George MacDonald, A Dish of Orts
tags: creativity, god, imagination

quote: if you believe in creativity,you will find solutions for every problems.
author: Thanakit Chansong
tags: creativity

quote: We want you to take from us. We want you, at first, to steal from us, because you can't steal. You will take what we give you and you will put it in your own voice and that's how you will find your voice.
author: Francis Ford Coppola
tags: creativity

quote: Lies can open up the doors to imagination.
author: Lionel Suggs
tags: creativity, imagination, lies

quote: Art for Art’s Sake is for the well fed. The well fed are all the babies in cradles and my kitty along with them, and I am happy if my writings are for my kitty.
author: Lara Biyuts, The Dome
tags: art, creativity, culture

quote: I hope that I capture something in my work that is about the elusive, the magical and powerful and the transformative. The writing in itself is transformative for me.
author: H. Raven Rose, Liquid Me: Poetry and Prose
tags: creativity, on-the-elusive-in-writing, on-writing, writer-quote

quote: If I create from the heart, nearly everything works; if from the head, almost nothing.
author: Marc Chagall
tags: creativity, heart, inspiration, inspirational, mind

quote: The arts especially address the idea of aesthetic experience. An aesthetic experience is one in which your senses are operating at their peak
author: when you’re present in the current moment
tags: when you’re resonating with the excitement of this thing that you’re experiencing

quote: To labor in the arts for any reason other than love is prostitution.
author: Steven Pressfield, The War of Art: Break Through the Blocks and Win Your Inner Creative Battles
tags: creative-thinking, creativity, inspiration, sociology, writing

quote: And so we keep on thinking, because the next thought might be the answer.
author: Jonah Lehrer, Imagine: How Creativity Works
tags: creativity, imagination-reading, thinking

quote: I place my fingers upon these keys typing 2,000 dreams per minute and naked of spirit dance forth my cosmic vortex upon this crucifix called language.
author: Aberjhani, Visions of a Skylark Dressed in Black
tags: aberjhani, books, creativity, determination, dreams, endurance, famous-authors, famous-quotes-from-classic-books, genius, jack-kerouac, language, literary-inspiration, literature, nanowrimo, national-poetry-month, prolific-authors, the-writing-life, words, writers, writers-and-writing

quote: With cold eyes and indifferent mind the spectators regard the work. Connoissers admire the "skill" (as one admires a tightrope walker), enjoy the "quality of painting" (as one enjoys a pasty). But hungry souls go hungry away. The vulgar herd stroll through the rooms and pronounce the pictures "nice" or "splendid." Those who could speak have said nothing, those who could hear have heard nothing.
author: Wassily Kandinsky, Concerning the Spiritual in Art
tags: art, artists, creativity, imagination, inventiveness, originality, painting

quote: Just as no monkey is as good-looking as the ugliest of humans, no academic is worthier than the worst of the creators
author: Nassim Nicholas Taleb, The Bed of Procrustes: Philosophical and Practical Aphorisms
tags: academia, academics, art, art-history, artists, arts, creativity, criticism, critics

quote: The boys were amazed that I could make such a poem as that out of my own head, and so was I, of course, it being as much a surprise to me as it could be to anybody, for I did not know that it was in me. If any had asked me a single day before if it was in me, I should have told them frankly no, it was not.That is the way with us; we may go on half of our life not knowing such a thing is in us, when in reality it was there all the time, and all we needed was something to turn up that would call for it.
author: Mark Twain, Joan of Arc
tags: creativity, inspiration, muses, poetry, unexpected

quote: Your page stands against you and says to you that you are a thief.
author: Marcus Valerius Martialis, Epigrams
tags: creative-process, creativity, literary-theory, literature, tradition, writers, writing, writing-process

quote: It doesn't matter if people are playing jazz or writing poetry -- if they want to be successful, they need to learn how to persist and persevere, how to keep on working until the work is done. Woody Allen famously declared that "eighty percent of success is showing up." NOCCA (New Orleans Center for the Creative Arts) teaches kids how to show up again and again.
author: Jonah Lehrer, Imagine: How Creativity Works
tags: 232, creativity, creativity-work, grit, imagination, success, work

quote: The great ages did not perhaps produce much more talent than ours,' [T.S.] Eliot wrote. 'But less talent was wasted.
author: Jonah Lehrer, Imagine: How Creativity Works
tags: 227, creativity, elizabethan, london, talent

quote: Writing and drawing are very therapeutic, but they are also an excellent manifestation tool. I teach my clients to draw what they want, or to write a story about it to bring the manifestation forward into the present.
author: Alice McCall, Wellness Wisdom - Inspired by One Woman's Journey with Breast Cancer
tags: abundance, abundant, create, creativity, drawing, happiness, inpsirational, manifestation, self-help, writting

quote: If you want to be creative, stay in part a child, with the creativity and invention that characterizes children before they are deformed by adult society.
author: Piaget
tags: children, creativity

quote: At least I understood that writing was this: an impulse to share with other people a feeling or truth that I myself had. Not to preach to them, but to give it to them if they cared to hear it.
author: Brenda Ueland, If You Want to Write: A Book about Art, Independence and Spirit
tags: art, creativity, writing, writing-life

quote: The poem or the discovery exists in two moments of vision: the moment of appreciation as much as that of creation; for the appreciator must see the movement, wake to the echo which was started in the creation of the work. In the moment of appreciation we live again the moment when the creator saw and held the hidden likeness. When a simile takes us aback and persuades us together, when we find a juxtaposition in a picture both odd and intriguing, when a theory is at once fresh and convincing, we do not merely nod over someone else's work. We re-enact the creative act, and we ourselves make the discovery again......Reality is not an exhibit for man's inspection, labeled: "Do not touch." There are no appearances to be photographed, no experiences to be copied, in which we do not take part. We re-make nature by the act of discovery, in the poem or in the theorem. And the great poem and the deep theorem are new to every reader, and yet are his own experiences, because he himself re-creates them. They are the marks of unity in variety; and in the instant when the mind seizes this for itself, in art or in science, the heart misses a beat.
author: Jacob Bronowski
tags: communication, creativity, discovery, reading, sharing, understanding

quote: Well into adulthood, writing has never gotten easier. It still only ever begins badly, and there are no guarantees that this is not the day when the jig is finally up.
author: David Rakoff, Half Empty
tags: creativity, writing

quote: I hate being a writer. i tend to stick my emotions in things that cannot reciprocate. I've become a whore for my craft.
author: Darnell Lamont Walker
tags: artist, creativity, whore, writer

quote: ...Why are corporations so fleeting?...Instead of imitating the freewheeling city, these businesses minimize the very interactions that lead to new ideas. They erect walls and establish hierarchies. They keep people from relaxing and having insights. They stifle conversations, discourage dissent, and suffocate social networks. Rather than maximizing employee creativity they become obsessed with minor efficiencies.
author: Jonah Lehrer, Imagine: How Creativity Works
tags: 210, cities, corporations, creativity, culture

quote: The vocational approach at NOCCA (New Orleans Center for the Creative Arts) helps build grit in students. It teaches them how to be single-minded in pursuit of a goal, to sacrifice for the sake of a passion. The teachers demand hard work from their kids because they know, from personal experience, that creative success requires nothing less.
author: Jonah Lehrer, Imagine: How Creativity Works
tags: 233, creative-arts, creativity, grit, motivation, success, work

quote: Fear and self-doubt are the deadly enemies of creativity. Don’t invite either into your mind.
author: Don Roff
tags: creativity, fear, inspirational, mind, self-doubt, writing

quote: The most beautiful work of art that we can create is this life.
author: Kristi Bowman
tags: art, creativity, life

quote: Creativity and ideas fired between every synapse underneath my skin and I felt radiant from the inside out.
author: Belinda Jeffrey, One Long Thread
tags: creativity, ideas, radiant, skin

quote: I am the wood frame, the bundle of ox hair, and the creative spark... my value unhangable.
author: Marina Leigh Hatfield
tags: artist, creativity, painting, value

quote: One with true creativity can erase their one past, and replace it with an infinite number of pasts, creating new possibilities for the future.
author: Lionel Suggs
tags: creativity, possibilities

quote: What drives innovation is abundance and ease, not the pressure of scarcity.
author: Adam Gopnik
tags: creativity

quote: If you knew all about it, it wouldn't be the leading edge.
author: Karl H. Pribram
tags: creativity, discovery, innovation

quote: There is nothing in the world which an artist cannot recreate into something poetic, ennobling. And why do we read these things? They are not facts, they do not improve our business skills, our techniques in manufacturing goods, the management of a home. That is what most of you will be doing anyway. We read these because they teach us about people, we can see ourselves in them, in their problems. And by seeing ourselves in them, we clarify ourselves, we explain ourselves to ourselves, so we can live with ourselves…
author: F. Sionil José
tags: art, artist, creativity, filipino-authors, literature, poetry

quote: Purpose stirs creativity, without purpose you life will be in abnormal use(abuse).
author: Ifeanyi Enoch Onuoha
tags: creativity, enoch, ifeanyi-onuoha, inspirational, purpose

quote: This book began with the assertion that Margaret Fuller's life was her most remarkable creation. It is just possible, however, that her most wonderful creations may still lie in the future. Fuller's most precious gift to us may reside in the ideas and the works, still yet to be imagined, of women and men who follow her example. We may decide that, despite all that Margaret Fuller endured and suffered in order to become exceptional, her life, or rather her lives, well deserve imitating.
author: John Matteson, The Lives of Margaret Fuller
tags: books, creativity, imagination, life, people, possibility, time, wonder

quote: Our job in this life is not to shape ourselves into some ideal we imagine we ought to be, but to find out who we already are and become it.
author: Steven Pressfield, The War of Art: Break Through the Blocks and Win Your Inner Creative Battles
tags: creative-thinking, creativity, inspiration, sociology, writing

quote: Creativity is contagious. Pass it on.
author: Albert Einstein
tags: creativity, inspirational

quote: We are never more creative than when we are at odds with the world and there is nothing so artistically destructive as comfort. Princess Leia taught me that.
author: Simon Pegg
tags: creativity, geek, inspiration

quote: Truly creative people care little about what they have done, and a lot about what they are doing.
author: Alan Cohen
tags: creative-act, creativity

quote: If you're "one in a million", and the world is full of seven billion people, that means there are seven thousand people just like you.
author: Jeff Goins
tags: creativity, individuality, writing

quote: Innate in nearly every artistic nature is a wanton, treacherous penchant for accepting injustice when it creates beauty and showing sympathy for and paying homage to aristocratic privilege.
author: Thomas Mann, Death in Venice and Other Tales
tags: art, beauty, bias, bourgeois, capitalism, creativity, egalitarianism, ignorance, subjectivity, sympathy, wealth

quote: To tell you the truth, though, I still haven't made up my mind whether I shall publish at all. Tastes differ so widely, and some people are so humourless, so uncharitable, and so absurdly wrong-headed, that one would probably do far better to relax and enjoy life than worry oneself to death trying to instruct or entertain a public which will only despise one's efforts, or at least feel no gratitude for them.
author: Thomas More, Utopia
tags: audience, creativity, writing

quote: In strange and uncertain times such as those we are living in, sometimes a reasonable person might despair. But hope is unreasonable and love is greater even than this. May we trust the inexpressible benevolence of the creative impulse.
author: Robert  Fripp
tags: benevolence, creative, creativity, despair, hope, love, reason, uncertainty, unreasonable

quote: The only way to maximize group creativity—to make the whole more than the sum of its parts—is to encourage a candid discussion of mistakes. In part, this is because the acceptance of error reduces cost. When you believe your flaws will be quickly corrected by the group, you're less worried about perfecting your contribution, which leads to a more candid conversation. We can only get it right when we talk about what we got wrong.
author: Jonah Lehrer, Imagine: How Creativity Works
tags: collaboration, creativity, groups, mistakes, right-and-wrong

quote: She has given me a way out.
author: Alison Bechdel
tags: art, creativity, growing-up, mothers-and-daughters

quote: It is a burden...(M)ake no mistake about that. Any great gift or power or talent is a burden and this more than any, and you will long to be free of it. But there is nothing to be done. If you were born with the gift, then you must serve it, and nothing in this world or out of it may stand in the way of that service, because that is why you were born and that is the Law."- Susan Cooper ("Merriman" The Dark is Rising)
author: Susan Cooper, The Dark Is Rising
tags: creativity

quote: If it aint broke, break it. Then build something better.
author: Jonathan Culver
tags: anartism, art, creativity, iconoclasm, new-thinking, originality

quote: We create our own reality. The blessing (or problem) with this is that when one creates one's own reality, one must live it! Are you living a blessing or is it a curse?
author: Gary R. Ryan
tags: a-course-in-miracles, aa, art, art-work, creativity, punishment, spiritual

quote: A work of fiction should be, for its author, a journey into the unknown, and the prose should convey the difficulties of the journey.
author: Anthony Burgess
tags: artistic-endeavor, creativity

quote: Be brave enough to live life creatively. The creative place where no one else has ever been.
author: Alan Alda
tags: creativity

quote: It is the artist who tries to gradually accustom people to the possibilities of a better state of things.
author: Catherine Amy Dawson Scott
tags: artists, change, creative-vision, creativity, human-nature, world-community

quote: The trick, of course, is to lose one day and come back to win the next. But that is possible only when we draw healthy pleasure and confidence from our creative processes.
author: John H. Lienhard, The Engines of Our Ingenuity: An Engineer Looks at Technology and Culture
tags: creative-process, creativity, losing, winning

quote: Creativity is a delicious dream from which I never want to awake.
author: K. Ford K.
tags: creativity, dream, imagine

quote: In fact, most of us see perseverance as a distinctly uncreative approach, the sort of strategy that people with mediocre ideas are forced to rely on.
author: Jonah Lehrer, Imagine: How Creativity Works
tags: creativity, perseverance

quote: , I found the whole modern world talking scientific fatalism; saying that everything is as it must alwayshave been, being unfolded without fault from the beginning. The leaf on the tree is green because it couldnever have been anything else. Now, the fairy-tale philosopher is glad that the leaf is green precisely becauseit might have been scarlet. He feels as if it had turned green an instant before he looked at it.
author: G.K. Chesterton, Orthodoxy
tags: creation, creativity, gratitude, humility, wonder

quote: Forgery, being the weirdest form of creativity there is, like antiques, costs lives. Why is it that antiques demand sacrificial victims? Dunno, but if they don't get enough, forgery does. You want proof? Here it is: Once a faker's found out, he dies. Truly. It always happens.
author: Jonathan Gash, Jade Woman
tags: antiques, creativity, faker, fakery, forger, forgery, lovejoy, sacrificial-victims

quote: Great people will always be mocked by those who feel smaller than them.
author: Suzy Kassem, Rise Up and Salute the Sun: The Writings of Suzy Kassem
tags: envy, greatness, hate, jealousy, life, mocked, success-quotes

quote: Seeds do not make a sound when growing, but can even reach the sky. Learn from them.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
tags: growth-quotes, life-lesson-quotes, life-lessons-quotations, matshona-dhliwayo-quotes, motivation-quotes, motivational-quotations, motivational-quotes-for-women, rise-quotes, success-quotes

quote: Self learner
author: reading.
tags: Lailah Gifty Akita, Think Great: Be Great!

quote: The best learners are the best earners.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
tags: career-quotes, job-quotes, learn-quotes, learning-quotes, matshona-dhliwayo-quotes, school-quotes, student-quotes, success-quotes

quote: Keep your eyes on your dreams, not on your haters.
author: Matshona Dhliwayo
tags: dreamer-quotations, dreamer-quotes, dreams-quotations, dreams-quotes, matshona-dhliwayo-quotes, motivation-quotes, motivational-quotations, success-quotes

quote: Success loves audacity.
author: Sravani Saha Nakhro
tags: success-quotes

quote: Your Success is my Victory and every Victory is my Success
author: Jan Jansen Easy Branches
tags: success-quotes, victory-quotes, win

quote: We often want quick answers, quick results, instant rewards, and that’s normal in our high tech, instant, Google driven world.To take that first step towards reaching a goal or realizing a dream, knowing that there will perhaps be a thousand more steps to follow in order to make it happen, can be daunting.It’s simple and yet complicated. The simple part of achieving success is that it just takes work. For me, staying focused on my goals and envisioning my dreams every day, makes the work flow almost on its own.The hard part is the mindset, and to not self sabotage, because you don’t believe in yourself. We often think we can’t achieve our wildest dreams or that we are somehow incapable, and then we never, ever take that first step.I never felt that I was a very confident person, but with the support of some wonderful people and my own inner fire, I kept going. The hardest part after working and working, was to actually accept that I deserved success.Success in itself is kind of scary too, as it comes with having to be responsible, and not flake out.
